Reviews.Title: “Heart sinker.......”
Reviews.Author: yummymummynorfolkUK
Reviews.Content: The location of the Inn is great, enviable location right amongst the beautiful shops on Via Condotti, excellent coffee shop next door, and just steps away from the Spanish Steps, so top marks for the location, I think this must be what the hotel base their pricing on. We had booked the standard room category, expecting that such a high standard of property would be well appointed at this level, but sadly not. My heart did sink when we entered the room, it was small, very small, and dark, giving us a very oppressive feeling. We had been on a real high, Roma is the most amazing place, but when we got to this room we felt really gutted to end our last few days here. We asked to upgrade, which the concierge - who was super by the way, was able to sort us out another room in a higher category for an additional 80 euros a night which I think was a reasonable price for the improvement we got in the room. So - this improved the situation, as the next room was much bigger, with nicer decor. I know Roma is expensive and you pay for location. My advice for this property is to choose a higher category of room than the standard types. The concierge recommended a restaurant to us called Guatano Costa, at Via Veneto - he booked us a table there, we had a fabulous dinner, the ambience is very en vogue - modern contemporary, excellent service, totally fabulous dining experience, I am grateful to the concierge for his advice on this one. Roma is magical, expensive yes, but you expect this. We loved our visit, and would definitely return , but maybe experience a different property that suits us more.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at The Spanish Steps..... remember that name.”
Reviews.Author: Irvansaid
Reviews.Content: We just came back from travelling around Europe for 24 days, our first stop was"The Inn", and oh boy what a nice hotel to start a long romantic trip, it was indeed a memorable stay. Gina, the previous reviewer is my wife, and we both were so grateful for the upgraded room, the view was fantastic and the room was quite spacious considering the super prime location this little boutique hotel is located. I was a little apprehensive at first, since I'm use to big hotels, because the entrance to The Inn was quite deceiving as it was rather small, a little dark, and yes... the tiny elevator scared me a little bit. But that was it, the room was surprisingly marvelous. If you are a shopaholic for branded fashion items than look no further, this is the hotel for you. Downstairs next to the lobby is Cartier, opposite is Bvlgari, Gucci etc etc. My wife nearly had a branded stroke, luckily for our credit cards, it was our first city and we didn't want to carry shopping bags all around Europe. So instead, we walked around Rome and I was surprised to see how close everything was! Trevi fountain, Colosseum, etc etc...nearly all tourist attractions are within walking distance. The service is another thing, it was great! I had great breakfasts, and if you guys from the Inn are reading this, please tell me what kind of coffee you serving in the morning? I miss that coffee. The Inn at the Spanish Steps, remember that name when you visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Rome,no where else to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ginahalomoan
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, Fantastic view,cozy and tastefull rooms, very clean and breakfast is superb! Location is excellent! In front of spanish steps, surround by high end designer boutique in via condotti right across Bulgary, gucci, hermes, prada, roberto cavalli. The staff is very nice, we got a free upgrade for the rooms! Flavia also very informative and helpfull! The services are excellent. Great place to start exploring italy.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home on the best shopping street in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: mainevent
Reviews.Content: I purposely chose The Inn for its location as Rome is the final stop of our fourteen-day vacation in Italy. Intended to shop on our last few days. Heaven as all luxury brands are at the doorstep, more around the corner at Via del Babuino! Despite location on real estate gold, the inn feels homey and comfortable. Rooms are very clean and charming, rooftop terrace a nice respite from the chaos outside. Breakfast spread quite good. Staff is outstanding--- helpful and sincere, thanks to you all very much! Metro is a short walk away, and other sites like Piazza Navonna, the Patheon etc. are within walking distance with a map. Streets near and around the hotel filled with restaurants, delis and shops. All Saints Church at Via del Babuino has opera nights, sublime. We took the advice of one reviewer of booking the limo service to the airport as our flight was 11 am. At 45 euros, a very good deal, instead of lugging heavy luggages around the train station on our last day, we were relaxed and arrived in good time at the airport. What a perfect end to a memorable trip!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but it works”
Reviews.Author: samuel04
Reviews.Content: You wonder if you've made a mistake when you enter the Inn - it's hidden away off the most impressive street in Rome. And the reception doesn't give away anything either. It's only when you realise that the position of this hotel is everything that you understand why this hotel is a hidden treasure; a one minute walk and you are at the Spanish Steps, 30 minute slow walk to the Vatican is the longest you can take. And the roof terrace is something else when you know that five floors below there are thousands of people rushing around. Breakfast is a pleasure as is late afternoon tea with complimentary nibbles. Staff were very helpful with everything we needed. And we shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Priceless memories.”
Reviews.Author: carmelsunset a
Reviews.Content: This little inn sits next to everything you will want to see. The joy of being able to walk to shopping, sites and fine dining. We have stayed other places in the past and the motions of getting a taxi and hurrying to get home after an evening out detracted from the old world feel. The Inn allowed us to mantain this European feel from the beginning to the end of a day. Our room looked out at the Spanish Steps and the dull murmur of people talking as well as the fountain was a welcome backdrop. A true piazza feel! The staff was extremely friendly, the linens perfect. Really it was worth the splurge. If you are in Italy than it pays to stay in the heart of it. The Spanish Steps are the heart and the Inn is the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Victorkwok
Reviews.Content: Just finished a medical conference in Denmark and landed here (still here). Great disparity between Denmark hotel and here. This place has superb location; downstairs is prada, Gucci etc, like living in Orchard Road in Singapore. Its walking distance to all attractions. Rooms are average size but decent and very clean. But won't be in design magazine catalogue. Place is homely. More character than hotel chains. Not budget hotel or low class inn, don't worry. Staff is extremely polite and helpful. Especially the lady at reception counter who gave a good restaurant recommendation at Marco G. Gonna stay for another 2 days in this beautiful city. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelleatzmon
Reviews.Content: A wonderful little hotel, excellent location. Walking distance to all important places and shopping centers

Reviews.Title: “Ideal romantic break away”
Reviews.Author: Niamhod84
Reviews.Content: I cannot describe how fantastic this hotel was. From the beautiful and immaculate rooms to the welcoming and professional staff it really is the ideal hotel to stay in while visiting Rome. We were upgraded on arrival by the lovely Karina to a frontfacing room with a view right up to the Spanish Steps. The hustle and bustle was right outside our window from morning until evening but once the heavy curtains closed we didn't hear a thing. The snow in Italy came down on our second day and although we were disappointed that a lot of the sights such as the Vatican and the Borghese was closed we enjoyed the romance of the city and the absolute delight of the Italians. Families were out in force enjoying the weather and spirits were high. This hotel is wonderful for a couples break away and is a little oasis of peace and quiet after a days trekking! Enjoy x

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sjefftx
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome on the first leg of honeymoon and The Inn At The Spanish Steps was our first hotel. The location is as good as it gets and allows for walking the city and/or short taxi jaunts. The hotel is small enough to be considered quaint, but staffed as well as any of the bigger ones. The staff was very helpful and went out of their way to make our 4 night stay quite pleasurable. They offered magnificent restaurant recommendations and reservations, accurate and helpful walking directions, and daily service that really helped make our stay relaxed and easy. The free breakfast upstairs was first class and a really nice touch as well as the happy hour. The room we stayed in was located in the main hotel building and it was small(as most European hotels are,) but quaint and well appointed. If there is any complaint, it would have to be the bed. It was the hardest bed I have ever slept on and could really only compare it to sleeping on a dining room table. We enjoyed the hotel very much and made it through the stay on the bed and slept pretty well, but if these recommendations are going to have any merit I believe that issue has to be mentioned. Hopefully they will look into upgrading the beds in the near future. I would recommend the hotel to others, but I would want them to be aware of the bed situation before making their final decision. If the bed situation is remedied I cannot think of any reason not to stay at this hotel. In fact, I would say to stay anywhere else would be foolish.

Reviews.Title: “great location fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: judith s
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the inn at the spanish steps for the second time .The rooms are beautifully furnished ,modern clean spacious ,at the best location .The service very helpful ,I greatly reccomend .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and overall lovely”
Reviews.Author: Louiangel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 4 nights at the end of Jan and was picked up from the airport in a comfortable car which was included in the package we booked. I think we would have been shattered trying to find it in the rain had we had to get the bus. Check in was easy and our room was spacious and clean. One downside was the lack of tea/ coffee in room - this wouldn't have cost much and if like me you like tea before bed bring a travel kettle. We were informed that breakfast was a full English however it wasn't (although probably some discrepancy in definition). It consisted of lots of lovely cakes, pastries, cereals and a bit of cold scrambled egg and bacon. What didn't help was the seating- wicker sun lounger type chairs not conducive to sitting up and eating more suited to sitting back and relaxing and quite uncomfortable. The hotel did offer a free buffet in the evening but the drinks were charged and weren't cheap. The hotel was in the perfect location for all sights and very comfortable after a long day. There is a spar supermarket and a mcdonalds cafe round the corner to solve the tea problem. Lots of lovely restaurants close by near the steps. Lovely designer shops on the same street. We were due to come home the day after the snowfall and we had booked a private care back to the airport. We were informed on the morning of our departure Franco at reception informed is the cars were not running and we would have to rely on taxis or public transport. Easier said than done when not a taxi in sight and a vey difficult walk with bags to the stations. However Franco and the staff were wry helpful and actually walked out onto the piazza in the snow to find us a taxi. Not the cheapest taxi ride but peace of mind to reach out flight in time. Thank you to all who helped much appreciated. Overall if I came to Rome again (which I will as it's a beautiful city) I would stay here again but I would not pay for breakfast (25 euros each per day) as not worth it and would like to sit up properly.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt have asked for a better location”
Reviews.Author: kim1310
Reviews.Content: I booked the Inn at the Spanish steps for a 4 day trip to Rome. As it promised to be on Via Condotti, I was filled with expectations. After reading the reviews, I was a little nervous. However, I must say that the room was beautiful and far exceeded my expectations. The staff including Franco, Pascal and the lovely ladies at reception were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was delicious and better than what is offered in most good European hotels. Finally I wish to say that there is nothing more wonderful than being able to drop off your shopping every hour and to pop into all the lovely bars and restaurants just a minute or 2 away.....I cannot wait to go back and stay in my favourite hotel in ROME!

Reviews.Title: “3 wonderful days at the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: marikajkilleen
Reviews.Content: It's the very first time that I write a comment on a community site like tripadvisor, but the Inn at the Spanish Steps deserve it! I found the hotel on booking.com. The rate was good, but I thought it was better to make a call to the hotel directly and see if there was any cheapest rate available if doing reservation over the phone. i spoke to Karina, and I immediateky understand she was a sweet and professional receptionist. She offered me a great rate with a compimentary upgrade. No need to say that I made the reservation with the hotel directly! I sent an email with my cc details and after 10 minutes I did received the confirmation by Karina. Fast and professional. At check in I have been welcomed by Franco, who speaks a fluent english and is very well informed about restaurants in the area. He gaves me great suggestions for dinner and every place had fantastic italian food at reasonable prices. As promised by Karina, I have been upgraded to a deluxe room, spacious and very well appointed. Breakfast was included in my rate and I enjoyed it every morning on their beautiful rooftop terrace. I will surely come back to the Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Executive room on Via Condotti.... Beautiful....”
Reviews.Author: mandanarhughes
Reviews.Content: My wife convinced me to spend some days in Rome to go shopping in occasion of the winter sales and we couldn't choose any better location. The inn is right on via dei condotti, which is the heart of shopping district in Rome. Among the variety of room category available on the inn's website, we booked the executive at a very discounted rate. There were special offers available and we got the seasonal sales offer, as sponsored on tripadvisor page. The room was beautifully decorated with a canopy bed (and a very comfortable mattress!). The service there is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location (and service too...)”
Reviews.Author: Lux-Hki
Reviews.Content: As the purpose of our trip was shopping there really wasn't any other choice than the Inn at Spanish Steps, right on Via Condotti! We found a great prepaid deal on hotel website including breakfast, wifi and 'upgrade upon availability'. When we arrived the fabulous service by Giordana at front desk set a luxurious tone to our entire stay! The room we were upgraded to was located in a different building than reception but this was no problem at all, bellboys handled the luggage. In fact we rather enjoyed the private feeling of the floor where the room was. Rooms were large in Roman standard, clean and stylish. The breakfast was adequate in all ways, although the breakfast room is the smallest I've every been to, seats max 12 people or so. But we never had trouble finding a table and seats. As we arrived rather late we had asked in advance the hotel to book a restaurant for us and after the excellent dinner at restaurant 59 we actually opted to let the hotel arrange all our restaurant selections and reservations for us - every time hitting the nail no matter what our particular wishes were... We will definately stay here on our next stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great concierge”
Reviews.Author: Scoobyru
Reviews.Content: We came to Rome for a wedding in October, and chose this hotel based on its proximity to wedding festivities. It proved to be the exact type of hotel we wanted: small, quiet, a real respite from the tourist crowds of the Spanish Steps. The rooms were small, but we were upgraded to a very spacious room because we're members of the Small Luxury Hotel Club (SLH). It's free to join, and if you book your room through SLH, you should definitely join for the perks. The rooftop bar was a HUGE plus to the property! We specifically asked not to be in the annex, so that we could enjoy many a peaceful breakfast and cocktail hour on the roof. Best of all was the Concierge service. Not only did they recommend our favorite restaurant of our Rome trip, but they also helped my boyfriend track down a rental tuxedo for the wedding. We were definitely happy with our choice of the Inn at the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: Judy M
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the main building of this hotel on two different trips and find it to be in a perfect location near the Spanish Steps, the Borghese, many restaurants, Condotti Street and Trevi. It is also convenient to the underground. The hotel staff is very accomodating and tries successfully to fill any request from making dining reservations, suggesting great restaurants that are not real pricey, arranging transportation to and from the airport. The rooms are beautifully decorated and the hotel has a rooftop terrace overlooking Condotti Street with the Spanish Steps at the top of the street where you can enjoy cocktails with snacks and the great breakfast served in the morning. There is a small evelator to service the main building. The elevator does not go all the way up to the terrace so you must walk up one flight of stairs to reach the rooftop, but the climb is worth it. The entrance to the hotel is on Condotti Street just about 1/2 block from the Spanish Steps and next to the Caffe Greco. It is a good choice when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rahmies
Reviews.Content: i'll make this short and concise: - helpful and friendly front desk. recommended some amazing restaurants to us that weren't overpriced and had incredible service and food. - rooms: we stayed in the main building. extremely efficient room staff. we left our room at 7 in the evening once, came back and noticed the staff had come back (again) to fold our towels and turn down our beds. in europe, that's not typical. - location: after walking everywhere in Rome for 5 day, i can safely say that you won't find a better location than this hotel. special: we arrived quite early, and our room had not been vacated yet. so we were invited to the terrace to have some coffee. they unexpectedly welcomed us with a delicious strawberry cheesecake.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Tanya0810
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the tinny inn at the Spanish steps in Rome November 2011. The location is perfectly close to everything; very central if you want to mix shopping and site seeing. It is also right next to the oldest cafeteria in rome. It is located on via del corso which is we're all the higher end retailers have shops. But all around the area you can find shops for all budgets. Don't miss the new Zara flagship store. It as 5 floors and beautiful set up. The hotel is really small but charming. The entrance might scare you (no elevator to bring your luggage to the small reception room) but don't worry, the staff is great and helpful. The rooms are just beautifully decorated in traditional roman art. The furniture and beds are comfortable. Just outside to the left and few yards to the Spanish steps. They recommended great restaurants in walking distance. Trust them. The terrace has a nice cozy section for breakfast to drinks (they offer a 5-7).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - location, staff, appointments”
Reviews.Author: Michael800
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed the hotel's location (on the high end shopping street Via Condotti at the base of the Spanish Steps), its always-friendly and helpful staff, our beautifully appointed room with ceiling fresco, and the rooftop breakfust buffet and evening snacks. When we made our reservations, we were careful to specify the main building instead of the annex, and we also asked for the frescoed ceiling. They did have to move us to another room on the last day because they had to look for a leak from somewhere on our floor. They were gracious about the move and upgraded us to a room with an identical floor plan and location but on a higher floor with a small terrace we didn't have before. I'm glad we didn't pay for that type of upgraded room, as we didn't like the decor as much (too animal kingdom & modern) and the terrace was too small for furniture, so it wasn't like we could sit out there.

Reviews.Title: “Location and perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: Banshaker
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, cosy and so clean hotel. Wonderful breakfast, great personalised service, everywhere is made easy. Many thanks to the staff, you are great and you have a wonderful team. Ban Shaker

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ramiikbal
Reviews.Content: "Extremely pleasant stay. A very warm welcome for us! Excellent in every respect, the rooms are very comfy, food is so great and all staff members are FANTASTIC... Would love to come back again." (Rami & Ban Ikbal)- Kuwait

Reviews.Title: “Not quite average even!”
Reviews.Author: TheMightyRawdon
Reviews.Content: It is in a great position but if you are looking for a luxury boutique style hotel, this is not it. The place is tiny and not particualry well appointed. I would venture to suggest that the owners are watching every penny and are not investing in the infrastructure of the place. Something that made us laugh was the offer of a drink on the roof terrace - it is a joke (you think you may be getting a glass of prosecco on the House, but you ain't!). Breakfast was served on the roof which sounds great. However, the place is overrun with pigeons and the hotel seems unable to do anything about it. Will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the annex and loved it; will definitely return again if we get a chance”
Reviews.Author: shinobirastafari
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the annex off-site, and would definitely return there again. It's a very pleasant apartment, somewhat removed from the crowded Via Condotti zone. The only headache was the extremely cramped lobby (or lack thereof), which made it difficult for us to check in and check out when there were other guests ahead of us. Even so, the room itself was excellent, and we appreciated being situated in a pleasant "locals" building which provided excellent WiFi service and a quiet comfortable environment. I didn't think staying in the Spanish Steps area could be so relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Kezbomb_8
Reviews.Content: Fantastic base for seeing Rome. Staff were friendly, rooms clean and quite spacious for Rome (bed was a bit hard) we had a room with views of the Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay with my family”
Reviews.Author: erikamillblmq66
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and we spent a five days stay at the inn last week. We booked a family room as our two kids are still too young. Family room was a great compromise as it is composed of two connecting rooms, totally independent each other. So we could have our privacy and at the same time we were able to look after our children, sleeping right next to us. Staff was great and patient, our kids loved Karina and Jordana!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: lisbethbjurvang55
Reviews.Content: We reserved a superior room at the inn and got a very convenient rate. Breakfast was not included but we used their room service and every morning we got cappuccino&croissant, italian style! Our room was quite and very well decorated. It was facing the courtyard and our room had also a small balcony where we could sit and read a book. The terrace on the fifth floor is amazing and we loved the afternoon buffet before having dinner in a nearby restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant ans stylish room”
Reviews.Author: erikagrossmanny5f
Reviews.Content: The Inn is amazing! Our room was quite, facing the inner courtyard, decorated with quality antiques whilst providing all possible modern coveniences. Front desk staff was extremely kind and professional and helped us a lot in arranging pick up service and visits to many museums. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: stifvermagnuss65
Reviews.Content: The Inn was really nice! Our room was beautifully decorated with personal touches evident everywhere. Location is great, it is the perfect place from which to explore Rome. All sites are within walking distance. We enjoyed breakfast every morning and it was so good! The staff was helpful and always smiling. Overall a truly lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: M29G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Via Condoti, really close to the Spanish Steps and Piazza del Popolo. The roof top terrace is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location. Great views.”
Reviews.Author: sisraelt
Reviews.Content: The Inn at the Spanish Steps in the most central location for touring Rome. It's a few steps to the Spanish Steps (you can see it from your window), short walk to Piazza Nueva, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Popolo and shopping areas. The metro/train is also a few steps away and a couple of stops to both Vatican, Termini and the Colosseum. The location is by far the most convenient for walking around the city and using public transportation on your own instead of taking cabs everywhere. The hotel itself is boutique like and very chic. The staff is very helpful and the happy hour and breakfast were both convenient and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbie966
Reviews.Content: We were alittle worried when our pickup from the airport was over an hour late, but once we arrived at the hotel all our worries were forgotten. We were met by wonderful staff that made us feel at home. Our room had great views, with plenty of room to move, I do question there idea on the size of a king bed though. Breakfast on the roof terrace was excellent and a great way to start your day.

Reviews.Title: “excellent city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: 01stephanie
Reviews.Content: we booked the executive room which had a small balcony overlooking condotti st. It was clean & well appointed. The afternoon tea on the rooftop terrace was excellent, as was the breakfast in the morning. All the staff were attentive & made our stay comfortable. A little oasis in the hubbub of Rome

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful....you could not find a better to explore Rome from.”
Reviews.Author: markshreeve
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, attentive staff, service could not be faulted. We had a small verranda from which we could see the Spanish Steps themselves. Lounge/breakfast room on top floor verranda was amazing a bit of tranquility above the frantic place of life taking place below. The complimentary mid afternoon tea, could easily replace an evening meal !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is luxury!”
Reviews.Author: gregorurghenst33
Reviews.Content: We booked a double executive room with balcony for our three nights stay in Rome. The room was charming, with a canopy bed and beamed ceiling. From the small balcony we could see condotti street where all the most famous shops are, and spanish steps is on your left hand side. Breakfast was served on the rooftop terrace. It looks like a garden, with its lemon trees ans flowers! The staff is great and always smiling. We took advatange of their transfer service to the airport, with private car and driver, and it's been a good way to end our fantastic stay at the inn.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: santiagoplacencia556
Reviews.Content: This place is our new favourite one in Rome! We booked the studio room among the several room categories available on their official web site. We chose the studio as pictures showed a very nice and modern room with kitchenette and independent entrance, furthermore it was the most convenient one! We loved the studio! Even though it is a little bit far away from the main building, you have everything you need there, it's like having a private house in Rome. Front desk staff is really friendly and professional. They helped is with restaurant and tours reservation. It' been a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room in the annex!”
Reviews.Author: florenziathugtdd1
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a double room on their web site and Karina @ front desk has been so kind to let us decide at check in time among a room in the main building and one in the annex. We booked a classic room with courtyard view, therefore we decided to stay in the annex cause the room there faced condotti street. The room was spacious, with modern decor. Internet connection, which was included in the rate, worked properly both in the room and in the lobby. They use to organize a private breakfast in the annex for guests who sleep there. Of course you can still reach the main building and decide to have breakfast on the terrace. We loved the annex, and it was not too far away from the main building, you just need to walk down condotti street!

Reviews.Title: “Like a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: BavariaB
Reviews.Content: We booked here when our apartment rental in Rome fell through. We try to choose small hotels or apartments whenever possible, so when we came across a room belonging to this hotel that was off the property (more like a studio apartment) we figured we'd struck gold---an apartment with hotel amenities. Well, we'll never know, because when we arrived to check in at the main building, we were "upgraded" to a deluxe room (the rates were the same we later found out) in their property down the street (same name, many buildings---like a chain), which they told us was far superior to the room we'd booked. The decor and the atmosphere was what you'd expect from a chain hotel--a better chain, but a chain nonetheless. Housekeeping knocked on our door several times and at all hours to ask if we wanted more towels--one knock a day is enough. The concierge staff was helpful and recommended excellent restaurants in the area. We found that giving a hotel on Condotti as your destination to the cab driver tacks on 10Euros to your trip. It's the Madison Avenue equivalent of NYC. The view from our room was of a retail store. The breakfast was expensive but bountiful and served on a pretty terrace (in the main building) with a stunning view BUT this was the first and only coffee I had in Italy that was not good. Overall, we were not impressed. The price tag and star rating are too high and really undeserved. There's nothing unique here. Nothing special. Made for the masses.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Stockyardspacking
Reviews.Content: Here are the reasons for the star rating: - Our room was in the annex which was 3 blocks from the main hotel. This meant we had to walk to the main hotel or happy hour and to take advantage of the rooftop deck.  The hotel did not inform us prior to our arrival that this would be the location of the room. - The annex smelled horribly of smoke and the smell was also noticeable in our room. - The shower height made it difficult for my husband to shower. - The air conditioner unit in the room was loud and disrupted our sleep. - The phone in the room did not work for contacting the main hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: thaochiegg98
Reviews.Content: Great location, welcoming staff and clean room. We had a very nice time at the Inn, beyond our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: hildebrandasandahh21
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! They upgraded us to a deluxe room in their annex building which was very nice! Actually, it was one of the deluxe rooms shown on their website, with modern decor. The annex is 3 blocks away from the main building but they serve a private buffet breakfast in the lobby, so you don't need to walk to reach the main building, apart for check out procedure. The room was air conditioned and it was good cause in Rome it's still summer! The room was clean and the bathroom was very comfortable. Staff is friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Charming decor only goes so far...”
Reviews.Author: Deborah M
Reviews.Content: When choosing accommodations the top 3 most important factors for my happiness are safety, location, and comfort. This hotel is undoubtably in a great location (perfect actually). I also felt very safe day and night. The most disappointing was the terrible mattress. I upgraded to a fresco ceiling room to celebrate the end of our amazing 2 weeks traveling throughout Italy. We even bought an amazing bottle of champagne to share. Upon entering a long narrow corridor to reach a security door we were buzzed into a non-lobby with a desk to check in. The staff was friendly and helpful. I was reasonably happy until being escorted to our upgraded room where I found a bed maybe knee-high with a mattress so worn and used I could (literally)feel springs. I immediately went back to the check-in room where they offered a different room with a better view at no charge. The bed in that room was no better. They refused to allow me to check out without penalty and go elsewhere (outside the cancellation period). They placed mattresses from the roll away cots on top of the mattress which helped slightly. Overall the staff did what they could to make the bed more comfortable. The reality is the only thing I wanted was a comfortable bed and that was they only thing that could make me happy. I was disappointed that I paid approximately 450 euro a night for the quality I received. I won't be back and would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Two days of non stop shopping in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: arizaflorentin66h
Reviews.Content: It's been a wonderful week end! We chose the inn at the spanish steps for its location and it was perfect! The area is fully of shops and it's been a hard time for our credit card!! Our room was specious and not too expensive. Breakfast, which was included in our room rate, was great! We'll go there again, maybe for next seasonal sales!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it for a treat”
Reviews.Author: AA10
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a long weekend in Rome. Hotel is in a great location and the staff are fantastic couldnt do enough for you. We were upgraded from a classic to a superior room which was a great size. Was worried that hotel might be a bit noisy in view of the location but once in the room you felt away from all the bustle of Rome. Between 5-8pm complimentary snacks are served on terrace but drinks are expensive. We also had breakfast included in room rate if you don't it is 25 euro each which I think is a lot. Tip would be to get a card from small leading hotel group before you book as you get complimentary breakfast and upgrade if available. Nothing to fault with hotel at all

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: balingrayhowac55
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel impressed us! We spent a couple of days there before catching our flight back home, after a 10 days cruise. The room was spacious with amazing modern decors. Bed was comfortable and the bathroom had jacuzzi bath. The price we paid was fair, considering that you are right at the spanish steps, next to prada, bulgari and any other famous shop! We've been welcomed by Franco, who gave us lots of suggestions for dinner and places to go. Our stay was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Truly a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nicholasfrantrontt54
Reviews.Content: We will recommend this hotel to all of our friends. To be at the spanish steps, our rate was a deal! There is a promotion going on (which we found on trip advisor!) and we've got a discount on the room rate and wi fi included in the rate. They upgraded us to a deluxe room with jacuzzi in the bathroom! At check in time we've been informed about the afternoon buffet (snacks are included in the rate, drinks are at a charge) and we enjoyed it everyday. We suggest you to do the same, it worth it!

Reviews.Title: “We spent two wonderful days at the Inn!”
Reviews.Author: marcinkgrecay87
Reviews.Content: It's been a very nice week end! Our room was superb and we got a very good rate (booked their special offer online and got free internet included as well as the breakfast!). Front desk guys are friendly and smiling. Location is perfect! We'll book it again for a longer stay hopefully!

Reviews.Title: “Super! We will go back!”
Reviews.Author: vannozzstendhal156
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a visit to Rome, we highly suggest the inn at the spanish steps. Its location is perfect, with metro just few steps away. Shops, nightlife, monuments. Spanish steps is the very city centre! Breakfast is what we liked best! We always started our day with cappuccinos and cakes on their beautiful terrace.... Room was lovely and the courtesy of the staff made our stay truly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “I have recommended this hotel to everyone I know visiting Rome.”
Reviews.Author: JHeieck
Reviews.Content: We visited Italy in November 2010 on a historic tour. Rome was our last city. We stayed on a couple of extra days in Rome to sightsee and we selected the Inn based on trip advisor reviews. It did not disappoint. We had breakfast every morning on the roof lounge and closed out every night with a glass of wine and appetizers. The rooms were nice and clean. The staff was very courteous and attentive. The location is unbeatable! If we visit Rome again, we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: standhalkugthh11
Reviews.Content: Beautiful stay! The room was nice and very clean, staff is extremely friendly and helpful, location is perfect! You can't ask for anything better!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay in a dog friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nathalyeortegaBHG22
Reviews.Content: I booked a a room at the inn cause it is maybe the only hotel in the spanish steps area which accepts dogs. My little dog liked the food that they provided every day for her! Each staff member has been truly nice and welcoming with us, they helped me in arranging both the arrival pick up and the departure transfer to the airport at a very convenient rate (considering that it's a private car with driver!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: kafguimaraesyy1
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the inn before a cruise and we enjoyed our stay very much! It was our honeymoon and they upgraded us to a deluxe room in the annex overlooking condotti street. The annex has only four rooms and it was really nice. It is down condotti, near to the corso, ultra centrally located. Our room had a huge walking shower and the both the room and the bathroom were spacious ans clean. A good start for our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nickmastersonhh32
Reviews.Content: I chose the inn among the slh hotels in rome and I liked it very much. The front desk staff welcomed me as a club member and agve a free upgrade to a superior room which was very quite and cozy. Karina at the front desk has been truly helpful and suggested very good restaurants for dinner. i discovered that the view is their sister hotel and next time I'll book a room there!

Reviews.Title: “The best place we've ever been!”
Reviews.Author: manolitoheming23
Reviews.Content: We loved the Inn at the Spanish Steps! The room was on top floor and it was quite as it faced their inner courtyard. The staff is professional ans friendly, the know the area very well and you can trust them for any restaurant or tour suggestion. As many others reported, the afternoon buffet is great! Although you shall buy at least one drink, it really worth it cause there is a wide choice of appetizers. It's been a very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: justincuendmil56
Reviews.Content: We loved the Inn! Everything was perfect, starting from the front desk staff who welcomed us and made us feel at home. They gave us many good suggestions for restaurants and places to go. The room was truly nice and, considering that you are in the very city centre, it was quiet. Breakfast was delicious! We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ScarsdaleJayS
Reviews.Content: Recommended by friends we could not agree more. Upgraded from Deluxe to Executive room without asking. Room was amazing and not noisy considering location near the Spanish Steps. The morning breakfast on the roof was relaxing before touring. Staff was pleasant and efficient, though check in and check out seemed like something under the occupation with paperwork and stamps and receipts. I know alot of this in Europe but still took three times as long as other hotels in Italy. Would never consider any other hotel in Rome due to location and quality of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Stylish - location perfect.”
Reviews.Author: LesleyFlaminio
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are small and few, the Hotel is beautifully furnished and elegant. We had a room for three people. A huge King Size Bed and a very comfortable extra bed filled the room. The bathroom was well equipped and clean. The location is priceless - on the Via Condotti - in the heart of all the designer shops. The rooftop terrace was lovely for breakfast or for the complimentary snack buffet in the afternoons. The staff was professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location”
Reviews.Author: tpmack2
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this lovely hotel. the location is second to none and the rooms while small were very nice. the roof top terrace was the perfect location for breakfast and late evening drink. staff was very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Living the life of luxury at this Inn”
Reviews.Author: skynews60
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming. When you arrive you walk down a long corridor. There is an iron gate and you walk up a few stairs and then down a few to the office to check in. There is a bellboy there to take the bags. The lift goes up 3 flights but it is small so we walked to our second floor room and he took the bags. My 19 year old daughter and I had a deluxe room, though it came with no free internet, and no breakfast. I read that others had breakfast on the roof garden but we didn't know about it. We did go up to the top for drinks and fruit and other snacks at 5:30pm. The snacks are free, the drinks not. The room was stunning and classy. We were happy to be there after a week of more "college" accommodations in the Greek islands. The hotel is very security conscious. They filled out paperwork and needed my passport to buy internet time. I loved opening the window and looking to the left and there is the Spanish Steps. Wonderful part of town to stay in . Very classy.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: angelasedley
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and efficient staff made our trip memorable. The young ladies on reception were just the best. Will definitely return very soon..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and location”
Reviews.Author: zilli34
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by the charming Jordana who could not have been more pleasant and helpful. We has a few little issues which were sorted out speedily by Linda with no fuss and in a professional manner. Breakfast was delicious and eaten on the roof terrace overlooking the Via Condotti and the Spanish Steps. Great location and wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not really luxury”
Reviews.Author: CanadianRambler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the glowing reviews here, in Frommer's guide and elsewhere, but having now been there we would suggest you temper the expectations those reviews (and the hotel calling itself a luxury inn) will lead you to. We stayed here for our first 2 nights in Italy at the Inn, then travelled around Italy for the next week, then spent our last 3 nights back in Rome at a different hotel. I will review the various other properties separately but will only say by way of contrast that the Inn ranked 4th out of the 4 places we stayed. Other than 3 relatively minor things, nothing in particular was "wrong" with the hotel. The first exception to that was mostly just bad luck - we had a family staying down the hall with young children who apparently were still on North American time and who awoke us before 6 a.m. by going from their room to their parents approximately 30 times, with two accompanying door slams for each trip. This review isn't of said children's parent's parenting skills so I have not docked marks for that other than a slight deduction for the lack of soundproofing, which is unfortunately common in most of the hotels we have stayed over the years. The second issue is also minor but is the fault of the hotel - the towels were few and far between, and not what I would classify as suitable for a luxury property (small-ish and not very plush). We also had trouble throughout Italy figuring out why no facecloths, but I think thats more of a cultural thing than a hotel issue - it was the case everywhere except the big north-american chain we stayed at. Third, the room was exceedingly small and the bed exceedingly hard. There is a note on the hotel website that the classic double room (which we stayed in) in the main hotel are smaller than their counterparts in the annex, but I also note that there are no pictures of the smaller room on the website to show you just how much smaller. Since we forgot to take pictures, I will describe it as what I'll call the European classic, with maybe 5 inches on either side of the bed, and a bathroom with about 6 square inches of counter space. There was some room for clothes in a wardrobe but unpacking (or doing anything really) in the room was akin to playing Tetris given the lack of space. The bed along with the towels was also not what I was expecting out of something calling itself a luxury property - again the European classic, being small and a few notches above a piece of plywood in terms of comfort. The TV also only had about 3 working channels but we wouldn't have watched it anyway. On the plus side I can echo many of the other positives you will see in the other reviews. The location is truly outstanding, the staff very pleasant and helpful, and the rooftop lounge and breakfast are great as others have indicated. Everything was also very clean and the air conditioning blessedly worked well in the Rome summer heat. If this hotel marketed itself as something other than a luxury property (and/or charged less) I would not hesitate to give it a 5/5. However, for what we paid (almost 300 euro with the breakfast supplement) and with the negatives noted above I would rate it closer to a 3.5/5, rounding up to a 4 because of the great location and staff. I think the best way to sum up would be that we were disappointed because our expectations were so high - lower yours (and don't book the classic double) and it is probably a fine option. One other thing - if you are flying into Rome and staying here be sure to arrange to have them pick you up - in contrast to the other items this is a great value at 55 euro (pretty much what a cab will cost you) and its a huge relief to see someone holding a card with your name on it after a long day of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, romantic inn at the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: pjonthego
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small inn at the bottom of the Spanish Steps where we stayed to celebrate our 25th anniversary. The rooms have old world charm and the service was excellent. Every restaurant recommended was wonderful, and the front desk staff was helpful with questions from directions to prioritizing sites to visit to making dinner and taxi reservations. Katrina in particular was most helpful (she was usually at the desk when we needed help) The breakfast buffet was very good, eggs, cold cuts, pastries, and assorted fruit. It was nice to come back to the evening snack buffet after a day of touring. The location was excellent for touring; we could walk almost everywhere. My husband and I liked the layout of the hotel (not a straight halled, rooms off the corridor place) and the tiny elevator made us smile each time we used it. Be aware that the elevator does not go up to the top floor, nor the terrace where snacks and breakfast are served.

Reviews.Title: “We've enjoyed our stay so much!”
Reviews.Author: lukasandheather88
Reviews.Content: This place is so nice! The staff is attentive and responsive, they know the area very well and gave us many recommendations about what to do during our stay. Jordana was extremely sweet! She checked us in and offered a room upgrade for our honeymoon. Our room was located on the second floor, facing the inner courtyard, and it was truly quite. It's been a relaxing and exiting honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: guddymarilu11
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 4 and it was the first time in Rome for the all of us. This stay has been truly unforgettable... Rome is gorgeous, I guess it's the most beautiful city in the world and we were lucky to stay at the Inn, right at the spanish steps! This hotel is ultra centrally located and the staff make you feel at home. They care after us during our stay and booked private tours, restaurants and transfer service to the airport. Karina was the best, she's so sweet! Thanks everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Great! This is LUXURY!”
Reviews.Author: lenetyort63
Reviews.Content: It was my first time at the Inn. I go to Rome almost every year (I love shopping and Rome is the best place to do it!). I used to go to the Hassler, but my last stay there was terrible and I've decided to try something else. My choice has been the Inn cause I found their website so attractive! Rates were also convenient and I booked online with a discount. My room was in the annex and I liked it so much! The bathroom was spacious with a walking shower. Location was perfect as all my favourite shops were just there! The staff pampered us from the moment we arrived 'til our departure. They picked us up at the airport and organized the transfer back too, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - large rooms”
Reviews.Author: garveyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn and were blown away. A beautiful hotel with large rooms (we stayed in the Annex) and loved it. The rooftop terrace has nightly appetizers, and the service is impeccable. The only downside is that there is so much traffic on the street because of the high-end shopping. It is like staying on Fifth Avenue in NYC. So, although not ideal for me, you may see it as a benefit.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: barbratownsend36
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at the Inn. A friend of mine stayed there a couple of years ago and suggested me to book this nice property. I dare say it's been a very good suggestion! My room was very comfortable and they offered us complimentary items such as fruit and wine, much appreciated! They helped us in making reservation at the borghesi gallery and also took care of our flight reconfirmation. The staff is very efficient there!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and comfortable room!”
Reviews.Author: geraldinehoppert32
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for its location as I was looking for a place near the most important sites of the city. I like jogging and it' been so exiting to run every morning up to the spanish steps and villa borghese! Spanish steps at 6.30 am is amazing! The breakfast was rich and I could choose among a wide selection of fruit and cakes. My room was fantastic, with any comfort you could expect from a small luxury hotel. They upgraded me in one of the rooms in the annex building, down condotti street. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: amandahouswey64
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for a meeting and I booked the Inn cause I don't like staying in big hotels. Two of my colleagues reserved their room at the Hassler and were not satisfied at all. When they came at the Inn and saw my room they were impressed, like I did, by the nice decor. My room was facing the inner courtyard and was so quite! The staff called me by name and they always welcomed me with a smile, and when one is on a business travel it's always good to feel that familiar atmosphere. Their rooftop terrace is beautiful! Every morning I could not miss my cappuccino. Will be back with my husband!

Reviews.Title: “The best place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: monikausgrand85
Reviews.Content: My new favourite hotel in Rome. I liked the style of the room, which was also spacious and comfortable. The service was impecable: the front desk staff helped me in finding lots of shops to buy very original gifts to all my friends. They also gave me good suggestions for tours and restaurants. I will stay there again for my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but be wary if you have trouble climbing stairs.”
Reviews.Author: time2travelPhoenix
Reviews.Content: First I will start by saying that this boutique hotel is in a perfect location with very friendly staff and the most amazing views from the hotel roof where we recieved breakfast and had our afternnon snack and glass of wine. What I found was a pretty big problem for our group with one person having serious knee problems. The steps to get up into the room are plenty and they are quite steep for a person with walking problems. We knew it was a problem for us when looking to book this and it said on the website and through our travel agent there was an elevator. Well, there is an elevator but you have to go up steps to get to it and then it misses the third floor where our room was and even better did not go to the rooftop patio. The steps to the rooftop was actually more steep then any other staircase. So, I would highly recommend this hotel to people without any disability but absolutely not for someone with. For me personally it was a rooftop patio that you never forget with amazing views and really a fantastic breakfast in the morning that we looked forward to.

Reviews.Title: “It's been a deal!”
Reviews.Author: maggievandykmas54
Reviews.Content: Well, let's start from the rate: I booked one of the offers available on their site and I got a discount on my room rate and free internet connection for the whole stay! When I arrived there, they welcomed me in a very friendly and professional way, not a traditional check in. I could have a sit while they were doing the paperwork and in the meantime we talked and they offered me assistance for tours and restaurant reservations. The room I had was truly nice and the breakfast was superb! They use to serve breakfast on a terrace surrounded by lemon trees (can you imagine? Lemon trees in the very city centre) and flowers! It was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Sankofa7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a quaint hotel situated in the perfect location, near shopping and all the sights. We stayed in their loft suite which is a block or two away from the rest of the hotel, which was nice because it gave a reprieve from the flocks of tourists near the actual hotel. It is a separate apartment with a small kitchenette and it's own private entry. The staff at the hotel were very helpful. In addition, they offer a nice spread of appetizers around happy hour on their rooftop. After staying in some dire places in Rome, this place is worth the nightly rate.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: billf8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and son for 3 nights. We got nice triple room with view of the condotti. Beds were nice and soft and the front desk staff was really nice. Good location in busy down town area but close enough to everything. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate!”
Reviews.Author: gretchenkell66
Reviews.Content: I found the inn at the spanish steps so convenient from any point of view. The rate I paid was really a deal, also considering that you are in the heart of rome, close to the spanish steps. The service they provide is impecable and everybody there has been nice and helpful. The room was beautiful and location is gorgeus! My opinion is overall positive, as many of other clients who spent their roman holiday at the inn!

Reviews.Title: “I must have been staying at a different hotel to the majority of the reviewers posted on here??”
Reviews.Author: denisesims
Reviews.Content: I m struggling with most of the reviews... whilst the location was spot on... I have nothing but complaints and negative comments regarding this hotel... how it can be part of the 'Small Luxury Hotels of the World' is beyond comprehension...?? Where shall I start?? The very basic basic rooms??, the refurbishment of D & G at 5.30am every morning below our room, the leak that wasn't fixed during our 3 day stay... turning the bathroom into a wet room?? the generator that ruined any conversation on the terrace?? the 2 ft square room that had to accommodate 30 people for breakfast when it started to rain?? the list is endless... if you're looking for a overpriced,basic 'b & b' in a very noisy, overcrowded location... this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting hotel to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: Jandkat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and booked through the SLH group. We paid a high rate made plain at check in when we were reassured the wifi would be free because we paid so much. Great. Location cannot be faulted though. Very central and everything is walking distance. Staff were good, made every effort they could with what they have. Value for money is questionable given the lungarno portrait suites less than 100 m away which are substantially superior to this. We've stayed at many of the hotels listed in SLH and this should not be rated as 5 star. It is a good quality 4 star hotel in an excellent location but needs more to make it 5 star. The 'family' room is simply a portable bed in a slightly larger room, and with an appropriate price increase. The bathroom is very small and whilst appropriate for the age of the building, it's not appropriate for 5 stars. Cafe Greco is Italian snobbery at it's laughable best. The waiters will ignore you for up to 20 minutes before deigning to accept your order. Coffee was barely average but the service is classic Fawlty Towers. It is worth going in and watching for half an hour as an amusement. Have no fear that you'll be asked to order something. The inn mentions the cafe as a highlight hence my inclusion in this review. Nice, interesting hotel, better available for less $ spent. 4 stars not 5

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff!”
Reviews.Author: eleonortribeca63
Reviews.Content: We liked the Inn for its location, for the room which was really nice and for the breakfast, it was truly delicious and rich! But what made the difference there is the staff. Everyone has been really nice and gave us good suggestions on restaurants and place to go/see. They helped us in booking galleria borghese too! It's very hard to find tickets there!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: svenson25
Reviews.Content: We really can say that we had a great stay at this Inn. Upon arrival we were informed that our room had been upgraded that was a great surprise as this was our last night in italy. The room was huge facing out to the famous condotti street. We loved the location having the entire Rome in a walking distance from the hotel. Breakfast area was very cozy and full buffet breakfast was included. The staff booked us some great restaurants in the area and took care of our airport transfers at departure day. Great stay in great city.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful sunny week end in Rome”
Reviews.Author: hugoandfiona1
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful 2 nights stay at the Inn last week. We've enjoyed Rome so much, it was sunny and we walked everywhere. Location of the Inn is perfect to do so! Our room has been a wonderful surprise, much better than what I could expect! We purchased a room without breakfast, but the front desk staff suggested us to have breakfast there, as there was a special promotion and breakfast cost would have been reduced. Truly a good advice, as we loved the breakfast in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: francisdelakruz5
Reviews.Content: The inn is definetely my place in Rome. It's now the third time that I go there and it's always nice. As a regular guest, I had an upgrade into a deluxe room, which was really cosy and spacious. The staff is friendly and they welcomed me as I was an old friend! The complimentary appetizers served in the afternoon are delicious and even if drinks are at a charge I find it a good idea. Internet connection is not for free, but the are lots of special offers on their website which also include internet!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a bit of attention in a few areas then it could be special”
Reviews.Author: Conners37
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights over Easter here. It's a cracking property but falls short if you're looking for luxury, peace/quiet and great service. We were on the 4th floor, big room but the sound proofing needs looking at. Had to bang on the wall twice and call reception as we could hear everything next door very clearly - especially if someone is wearing heels on the wooden floor. The terrace above also is noisy at breakfast every morning. The bed was two beds pushed together which kept coming apart. There was no duvet, just a blanket and not exactly premium linen. We were told no duvets were available. For the money and the aspirations of the hotel, this was not really acceptable. Luxurious and cosy it wasn't, which was a shame as the room was special, had loads of space and bags of character. Finally the service was a bit all over the place, slightly comic at times and didn't really match the price. It's in an amazing location in an incredible city but The Inn at the Spanish Steps didn't reach the heights we were expecting having read other reviews on here.

Reviews.Title: “Easter in Rome”
Reviews.Author: genevievegrangt6
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Inn for our Easter break in Rome as there was a special offer available on their website. The room was not too big, but it was clean and very nice. The staff is superb! Always smiling and attentive. Easter breakfast was delicious, with cakes and chocolate eggs! Even if it rained a little bit, we enjoyed our short vacation so much and will choose the inn again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Italian ospitality!”
Reviews.Author: steraveroBGH
Reviews.Content: We've been welcomed by Karina and Pasquale. It was our first time in Rome (and in ìtaly) and both of them have been so kind to provide lots of information on tours, restaurants, places to visit. We walked a lot, as it's been sunny all our stay long! Don't miss the buffet on the terrace before dinner, we found it a very good idea cause you can relax a little bit before going out again for dinner! The room was nice and quite, although you are in the very city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: juliusholly32
Reviews.Content: We spent almost one week at the Inn and it was our second time there. The room we had this time was even better than the one we've got last year, they told us that they renovated some rooms and as we were returning after one year they offered one of the new rooms. They are very comfortable, with flat tv and nice decor. The staff is friendly and welcoming. Thanks to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “I was claustrophobic by the second day.”
Reviews.Author: teach7477
Reviews.Content: Very small, dark room. There was no place to sit other than on the bed. Also, there is no lobby. The only place to find a fairly comfortable place to sit is on tthe 5th floor where they have seating and an outdoor terrace with tables and chairs. The morning breakfast served there is very good. They also have complimetary snacks in the evening. If you want a cheery, comfortable place, I would recommend that you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Free internet and free upgrade”
Reviews.Author: jamesandannie85
Reviews.Content: We've just came back home after a super week end spent at the inn at the spanish steps. Booked the spring promotion through their website and got free internet connection and free upgrade to a deluxe room facing via condotti. Breakfast was superb and the staff has been extremely helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: gracerandmarta22
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Inn was memorable! From the first moment we found that place truly nice and welcoming. The room was gracious and comfortable. We will book the inn for our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tabonejill55
Reviews.Content: I discovered the Inn thanks to some friends of mine who previously stayed there, and I decided to try it for my short holiday in march. Definitely a nice place to stay, with professional and friendly staff, they gave us a wondeful room and lots of good advices for restaurants and sites to visit. Location was terrific! Will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay at the Inn!”
Reviews.Author: theodoretatcher98
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the inn has been unforgettable! We found this hotel on tripadvisor. As we heard many positive comments about it, we decided to try and we are now glad to share our experience with the tripadvisor community! The inn is a small property, don't expect a huge hall. The staff is truly kind and professional, our room was cozy with a mix of classic and modern furniture. The breakfast was superb each day! Really a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “A romantic Valentine's day”
Reviews.Author: jtorsten_jap5
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the inn for me and my wife to celebrate valentine's day, which is also our anniversary. The room was really nice and we appreciated the gift that we found on 14 feb evening: chocolate&strawberries for our anniversary! Each member of the staff has been so kind with us that we felt like home!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely!”
Reviews.Author: hughesrown65
Reviews.Content: We've loved that place! The room we had was a superior on the top floor. Breakfast is served on their rooftop terrace. Actually it is more than just a terrace, it is like a garden with flowers and lemon trees. Cherry on top: the front desk staff is professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury in the heart of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: GolaRS
Reviews.Content: Unforgettable stay at the Inn, where excellent staff combines with superb location and divine design of accomodation. It'definitely worth the money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite one among small luxury hotels!”
Reviews.Author: heatongroo99
Reviews.Content: I am a SLH club member and I booked this hotel for my stay in Rome. Besides the slh amenities I am entitled to get as a slh member, I received a high quality service and the room was really nice and charming. The breakfast is rich and the staff is always smiling. No doubt, it is the best slh hotel I ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “8est place to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: tepricen
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for a long weekend and prefer boutique style properties, so chose this one based on that, reviews and location. We were not disappointed!! The place itself is beautifully presented with individually styled rooms, our room was very spacious. Our favourite part was the roof terracewhere we had breakfast every day. Service was fantastic and we got a pretty competitive rate via Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, fantastic position and view, good service, but rooms were dark and dingy”
Reviews.Author: Su51_11
Reviews.Content: Disappointing. Although we had good service things were still forgotten like no bathrobes and slippers which was poor for a 5* hotel. We had to ask for them. Sometimes we had plenty of towels sometimes not. The freebie late afternoon/ evening snack at the sister hotel was a nice idea as there is no bar. We got a little gift everday which was nice but felt we had paid for it as it was very expensive. The postion of the hotel was good for a lot of sights. Unfortunately despite suggestions from the concierge and the travel books we never had a really good meal however hard we tried. Absolutely loved Rome itself, the sights are just mind blowing and we want to come back to see what we missed. Use the buses and get passs for 2 days to jump on and off at different points of interest as its hard on the feet walking everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing!”
Reviews.Author: madamegrunt
Reviews.Content: We read so many nice things about the inn and that we finally decided to book a room there. It's absolutely an amazing place to stay! We reserved a classic room without breakfast. The front desk staff offered us to add breakfast for just an additional 15 e per person per day and we actually did as the buffet was great. It's been a very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: magdasprings99
Reviews.Content: Our stay could not be nicer. The room was a little gem. We've been upgraded to a deluxe room in the annex. The afternoon buffet has been a surprised and we've enjoyed it each day. A special "thank you" goes to Karina, she's the kindest receptionist I ever met!

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience!”
Reviews.Author: Arongoldman
Reviews.Content: What a magnificent weekend in rome, nice place friendly staff spectacular location for shooping and sightseing. The bed was very confortable, the furnishing divine and the staff care was stellar. If you can affort it book it don't loose time going other places.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: danlal9628
Reviews.Content: Just few words to say that we really enjoyed our stay at the inn: perfect location, friendly and professional staff and gorgeus room! We'll choose it again for our future trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: twaindean5
Reviews.Content: I decided to book a room at the inn because I had previously read lots of positive reviews about it on many blogs and I now wish to share my experience too with other people. I had reserved a superior double room and the front desk staff has been so kind to upgrade me in a room in the annex and I liked it so much! The second thing I liked best was the breakfast and the kindness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “The kindness of the staff made the difference”
Reviews.Author: jordankirk59
Reviews.Content: My stay at the inn has been memorable. The staff, everyone, has been so nice and friendly! Always smiling and helpful. Franco helped me in booking two tickets for an important football match, Karina suggested lots of good italian restaurant and Pasquale was so nice to bring every morning my favourite newspaper! I felt like I was their preferite guest of the year! The room was cozy and location is terrific, just few steps from the Spanish step.

Reviews.Title: “Impecable service”
Reviews.Author: grettjoemina28
Reviews.Content: I found this place very comfortable. Location is perfect and I could walk everywhere, saving lots of money that I should have spent otherwise for taxi rides! The front desk staff makes the difference: all of them have been so kind but Karina is the best. She helped us a lot to have our bags back from the airport. The room we have been assigned to was small but very clean and with nice decor. Not noisy at all, considering that you are in the very city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Even more than what we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: barbrated81
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a big hotel with huge lobbies, then you need to go somewhere else. But if you prefer not be just a number, the inn is the right place for you. For the first time, each person at the inn did remember my name and it's nice to be recognized by the front desk staff. They have been extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms are big, very well furnished and - most important- clean. One word to describe my stay at the inn? Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable New year's eve at the inn!”
Reviews.Author: gracecapetown22
Reviews.Content: We decided to celebrate New Year's eve in Rome and while serching on the internet, we found a great last minute offer at the inn spanish steps. It was their last room available! Our room was exactly what we wanted! Spacious, clean and so cozy - it also had canopy bed, so romantic! Franco,the concierge, reserved a table for us in a restaurant nearby but before having dinner we enjoyed the buffet on their rooftop terrace. Shukri, the barman, prepared delicious snacks for the all of us. I think we will go back for our winter holidays on february!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking view of the spanish steps!”
Reviews.Author: hellenG523
Reviews.Content: We booked the junior suite last week end and view from there is gorgeous! You have the spanish steps right in front of you and it is amazing! To be at the spansih steps the rate is reasonable and by prepaying in advance I also got a huge discount. The service was impecable and staff is truly friendly. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: fridttgrut
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Inn has been really positive. We've been literally pumpered by the staff during our stay: Franco upgraded us to an exectutive room, which was so nice! It also has a small balcony on condotti street! Shukri is the barman and each day we spent at list one hour up to the roof top terrace to taste his snacks and cocktails... We felt the friendly atmosphere and it was like being at home... Very good!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: audreywilliamson
Reviews.Content: Decided to take my husband on a surprise trip to Rome and I booked the hotel on line without any great expectations. It reavealed to be a little gem due to its location and overall charm. We truly enjoyed our stay without kids and to be able to shop and sightseeing full time. The staff was extremely helpful which made things so much easier . We can sure reccomend it to other couples that want to get away for a relaxing break.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: joerads33
Reviews.Content: We spent our christmas holidays in Rome and booked a room at the inn. the hotel is really nice and the service is just perfect, as any other small luxury hotels. Reservations staff has been so attentive to our needs and sent several emails to confirm each detail of our booking. Front desk and concierge guys are friendly and professional. The is is one of the best small luxury hotels I have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Real Luxury! Great location, service and staff.”
Reviews.Author: gudrun77
Reviews.Content: To be Rome and staying in its most famous street its something absolutely special. This small luxury hotel combines location, service and friendly staff in a bond that its impossible to find in other hotels. We are so happy for having stayed here and we are going to return .

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: jsteincatcher
Reviews.Content: As if it weren't bad enough that the entire top floor sits under the breakfast patio, so one is awakened every morning at 6am by the screeching of the chairs on the tile and the banging in the kitchen, the hotel was also overbooked!! They had 'unanticipated' maintenance problems which allowed awful sewage stench to permeate the hotel. And because they had to close a few rooms, offered to have me spend the last night of my trip at another hotel. They offered to reimburse me for one night of my hotel fees for the inconvenience. And now they won't pay me. If this is the kind of service and environment that is provided by one of the "Small Luxury Hotels of the World", i'll obviously be staying elsewhere next time!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect roman holiday”
Reviews.Author: aaafritz
Reviews.Content: I was in rome for a long weekend and after reading many stories I booked the inn at the spanish steps and I was very happy about it.we did bay the airport pachage and our driver was fantastic and we arrived with no problem to what we now consider our new roman home ,our stay was so nice that we decided to go back as soon as possible.all the best shops just out the door,a lot of very good restaurant few steps away a fantastic room and a top terrace bar with a beautifull view . We can sure reccomend it .

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: gochal
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome, here's the details I was hoping to find when I was researching this hotel on TripAdvisor, so here goes Doesn't look like a hotel from the outside at all, so just want to set expectations up front. But with Prada and Cartier right next door, and Bulgari, Gucci and Louis Vuitton across the street, there's no doubt that this hotel is all about location location location. The lobby is tiny and nothing to write home about, but the porter Pasquale is very welcoming and inviting. More importantly, we arrived at the hotel at 8am after our redeye flight from NY, and even though our room wouldn't be ready until about 1pm, they checked us in and held our bags for us, so that we could wander around without having to worry about them. At that time in the morning, we had a choice between a room at the Annex and a room in the main building. They said the rooms at the Annex were larger, but based on the reviews I had read, I preferred to be in the main building because that's where breakfast and snacks are served. We ended up getting room 401, which faces onto a courtyard vs. the street, so there was no street noise like I had read about, but I have to admit it would have been fun to have a birdseye view from my window of the street, which is a bit of a people watching mecca, though probably overrun with tourists similar to how Times Square is crowded on a Saturday night in the summer. The room was relatively quiet, but every once and a while we'd hear knocking or water dripping very loudly in the middle of the night when it rained outside, which actually woke us up, believe it or not. I was pleasantly surprised by the room, it had one 110volt US outlet, which meant I didn't have to worry about buying a converter or potentially frying any electronics. A hair dryer was provided too, and the shower had great water pressure. And though the room was small, they still managed to squeeze in a decent sized flat screen TV! The 5th floor terrace is very charming, and the breakfast and afternoon/evening snack buffets are fantastic! They even served prosciutto, salumi and several types of cheeses and grapes.
