You can order a glass of wine to accompany the afternoon snacks. There's also a great view of Via Condotti and the Spanish Steps from the terrace. You have to pay for WiFi, but it's reasonably priced, and I was glad to not be tied down to an ethernet cable. The elevator is the tiniest thing I've ever been on, so be warned if you are claustrophobic. The staff all speak English, and it also seems a majority (or all) of the guests are from Stateside. The air conditioning was very cold, which is such a welcome change from my last experience in Italy, where the AC didn't work and so we had to open the windows and deal with buzzing mosquitos all night long. Overall, the rooms were very clean, and they even changed our towels twice a day. No, this is not a 5-star luxury full service hotel with all the amenities you'd expect for royalty, but it has charm, a good value (considering that there are many comparably priced and officially rated hotels that received much worse TripAdvisor ratings), and an amazing location. The only drawback is that the bulk of restaurants are a bit of a walk from here, as this is more of a shopping mecca vs a dining mecca. And you will have to take several steps once you step off the elevator, for those of you that can't do steps. Overall, a great experience, and I would DEFINITELY come back here next time I am in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Love the location and Room. Average everything else.”
Reviews.Author: purple_dots
Reviews.Content: We booked the executive double room which was on the highest floor. I loved the jacuzzi in the room, the HD TV (and good selection of English language channels to choose from) and the balcony overlooking Via Condotti and The Spanish Steps. The sound proofing in the room was good so it did cut out sound from the noisy street below. Big difference when you leave the windows open. What I liked about the hotel. 1. Location (especially if you love shopping and its close proximity to some lovely sites in the area - Trevi Fountain and Pantheon are just 15 to 20 minutes away). 2. Comfortable Room with nice attention to detail. 3. Complimentary tea time buffet (not a great spread but its a nice offering) 4. Cosy lounge area What I did not like about the hotel. 1. Mediocre service 2. Very tiny reception area. 3. Very tiny elevator (there is only one) but is expected from a building that is so old. 4. It classifies itself as luxury (the rooms maybe) but not the common areas. I would say it is `cosy' but that is about it. 5. Mediocre buffet breakfast 6. If you are driving - there is no garage for you to park your car. 7. No free internet access. Still, it was a comfortable stay. The room is great. The location is really prefect.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BDF43
Reviews.Content: We've traveled a lot in Europe, but never to Rome. We could not have picked a better hotel. The staff was outstanding and professional. The roof top terrace was a perfect way to top off the day. It may be on the higher side of pricing but when you factor in all of the positives this place has to offer, it is worth it. We traveled with another couple and we all agree. Great place! Minnesota, USA

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MegandTimC
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel in fact we extended our stay as the location is perfect, you can walk to all the attractions. We had a suite with a tiny balcony that looked straight up to the Spanish steps. The breakfasts on the roof terrace were good and it is just a great way to start the day. The evening snacks were a nice complimentary touch as were the lovely gifts left each day (buvlgari perfume and chocolates etc). The staff could not have been more sweet and helpful. The only minor negative was the noise that the laundry man made very early every morning as he crashed the trolleys on and off this truck, I watched him one morning and you could tell he made no effort to try to be quiet, actually the opposite appeared to be the case!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSusan
Reviews.Content: The location was great as it was right on Via di Condotti and very close to the Spanish Steps. The room was a good size but the beds were very hard. Most hotel have foam to deal with those who prefer a softer mattress but not this hotel and as a result we had four nights of poor sleep. The breakfast was good, although the seating on the rooftop area was in chairs not ideal for eating - they were more like living room chairs. The staff were very helpful at the front desk. It was the only hotel during our five stops in Italy where we had to pay for Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Not a small luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: JENKINSWILSON
Reviews.Content: The hotel was expensive,rude staff in the reception area.Very poor access to lounge and breakfast, on the top floor.Lift to only third floor then five flights of steep stairs to this area. No powder room at all, so a long trip back to your room if in this area.The breakfast was of very poor quality and only one pop up toaster for everyone.No area to even sit if waiting for friends or taxi, had to stand in the exit to the street. If wanting to speak to reception staff re bookings etc, had to also stand in hallway as no other area available. The room itself was shabby, chunks missing off bathroom wall and pieces of timber fell off the wall surrounding the bed.In all a very disappionting first experience of Rome. Inn at The Spanish Steps is not by any stretch of the imagination a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Hotel at a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: YetiAspen
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Inn at the Spanish steps with our four children, and could not have been happier with our choice. The hotel itself is very discreetly tucked away on Via Condotti right off the Spanish Steps. My husband and I stayed in a junior suite at the View at the Spanish steps (adjacent). Our room was a perfect corner room, very large and well appointed, that had a wrap around deck overlooking the steps. One night as we returned from dinner, an opera was being performed at the Spanish Steps, and we watched from our balcony! The breakfast served daily on the top floor terrace was lovely (included with the room) and abundant. What really sets this hotel apart, however, is the staff and the service. They treated us truly as guests. Franco, who I believe may be the manager, was very helpful with restaurant recommendations as well as anything that we needed. If your hotel preference is smaller, more boutique type of hotels, (as is our preference), do not hesitate to stay here. We will recommend to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay ,we will be back”
Reviews.Author: geltf
Reviews.Content: We have booked the inn at the spanish steps based on tripadvisor reviews and we are happy about it.The location is just beatifull just few meters from the spanish steps.W e did a lot of shopping while in Rome and to be at the inn is perfect.One day we went at the spanish steps and we got the roman carozella to go around and it was very nice . All the restaurant the reception suggeted us were all very good and not to expensive ofcourse they were full of tourist and italians. Our room was on the four floor with a small balcony on the street with a nice view of the square ,the roof terrace with the complimentary snack buffett in the afternoon was lovely. We will be back .... Geltrude ..

Reviews.Title: “Truly a great hotel, for rome”
Reviews.Author: luxurycomfort
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by several friends, and as you would expect we were unsure what the hotel would truly be like as people have different standards. The reception is accessed from the street down a hallway, and you walk into a small office sized room which gives a unsure impression of the hotel, if there is another person or group checking in around the same time as you, you may possibly wait up to 10 mins before you are served to be checked in, but its not too bad we didn't mind it too much, the reception guy is also the concierge. We went up to our room and it was really nice, i have stayed in some pretty bad hotels and some extremly nice ones too and this hotel room was at the higher end of the scale, everything was nicely finished and new, it had a big tv on the wall, a couch and the beds were very comfortable, one dissapointment was that when booking the room be assumed (inn spanish steps room with view) meant view of the spanish steps, but it does not neccessarily, our room had a view of one of the side roads which is full of upmarket shops such as gucci, dior etc, but if you stuck your head out the window you could see the spanish steps, we thought the room and its position was excelent, but just keep in mind it might be nice if your room faced the steps. The bathroom was nice and clean, not very big but its big enough. The room was serviced twice daily and fresh towels were supplied. The staff were all exceptional, if you wanted something done they would jump to attention right away. Upstairs is a very nice drink and snack room, where you have afternoon tea, breakfast etc and it really gives you a great idea of living in rome because its on the roof. I would recommend staying here because this hotel is bang smack in the middle of all the great action of rome...restaurants..bars..pub crawls..shopping..etc

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: frechertour
Reviews.Content: We travel often to Rome as my husband do business there. We found this special offer at their website including free pick up from the airport which was very appreciated after long travel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here as the room was comfortable and clean, breakfast was very good served on the roof terrace which was a nice surprise. The best thing of all was the location, full of shops just outside the hotel and not to mention all the good restaurants that you can find in the area. Ask the front desk staff as they gave us very good suggestions of places in walking distance from the hotel. Overall, we enjoyed staying at the Inn and were happy with our choice. Will recommend it and stay again on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for families!”
Reviews.Author: markdwyer5
Reviews.Content: We are a famliy of 5: me, my wife and our 3 kids. After some "shopping" on the internet, we decided to book a Family Room at the Inn: perfect choice! We had two connecting rooms and that allowed me and my wife to have our own privacy and, at the same time, look after our kids, just next door. Rooms were gorgeus with a wonderful view on Via Condotti!! They also put some gifts in our children's room and I found this very kind of them! Everybody has been helpful and friendly: Pascuale the bellman, Beatrix, Franco and Flavia at the front desk. It was nice to start and finish our roman days with their smiles! We'll be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at the Spanish Steps-Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: CaliLaugh
Reviews.Content: I researched a long time before I decided the Inn at the Spanish Steps would be a perfect stay for our 20th wedding anniversary. My husband and I were happy about the choice. The location is perfect, we walked to all the major sites and the official taxi service is right around the corner. The rooms are spotless, the staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast on the rooftop terrace is perfect and you can have ourdourves during happy hour, order some liquor or just take your own bottle of wine up. The rooms are small but they are all small in the city, just like New York, so if you don't want a small room, you will have to select a place that isn't centrally located like this hotel. When it was time to checkout, no need to call a Taxi, we just walked around the corner at 5am and took the Taxi. Everything is so convenient, they have an elevator if you don't want to walk the steps, just note the elevator doesn't take you to the 4th floor. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Problem Resolved Immediately. They are wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: robinCameronPark_Ca_
Reviews.Content: I was given full credit for our trip. I appologize for reacting so quickly. The hotel management has been extremely helpful in booking our next trip and we look foreward to staying with them. Robin

Reviews.Title: “Small, Old, Dirty and Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: TravelJLF
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on our honeyoom (our 7th hotel) We travel often and this hotel was just terrible but with a GREAT location if I may add. Our room was so small that only a full sized bed fit in the room. My luggage had to go on top of the mini fridge if that paints for you a clear enough picture. There was water damage on the ceiling, the walls were cracked, there was a hair in the toilet that was not ours upon arrival, our room looked out to the garbage area of the hotel and was next to the elevator shaft that was an exterior shaft which was a few feet from our window. It gets worse. I unpacked some expensive items that I purchased and didn’t feel like re-packing them again before we went out to dinner. I knew the turndown service would come in so we put the do not disturb on the door. When we got back from dinner sure enough.. they had been in our room and didn’t bother to look at the sign we put on the door. I was annoyed but checked my items and all were there. The next day again we put the do not disturb sign on again and AGAIN the room was made up. I was now really annoyed. I ran down and spoke to a manager. He said “Ill be sure to call the maids and let them know this is not acceptable”. Was he serious??? That didn’t make me feel better at all!!!! We stay at some top notch hotels and that was not the response I was looking for. Pros.. the best location, beautiful roof top terrace (which is good because we couldn’t sit in our small room so we did go upstairs). I would never stay here again! Ohh PS. When we checked out the manager did give us some small bottles of perfume as an im sorry. To be honest.. I would have liked a discount on the room instead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice! We would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jandm6
Reviews.Content: The Inn at the Spanish Steps was a wonderful choice. We booked a "Room with a View," and it was absolutely charming. The daily breakfast served right outside our room--either inside or on the terrace--was lovely. Beatrice helped book us a private tour of ancient Rome with Valentina, and it was the highlight of our Italian vacation. Every member of the staff, from Michael the bellman to Beatrice and Carlo, was outstanding, always giving us excellent advice and recommendations. If you can afford it, we recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - buggy room”
Reviews.Author: mriedema
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in May of 2009. Having previously stayed at the St. Regis Grand Hotel this hotel was a BIG disappointment. The room was small, and unbeknownst to me (my husband told me after we got home) there were bugs/roaches in our bathroom. The persons running the Inn could not have been nicer, and the rooftop bar was the picture-perfect setting for breakfast overlooking the Roman rooftops.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at The Inn at the Spanish Steps, Via Condotti, Roma.....be careful!”
Reviews.Author: MelanieEv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Inn on the Spanish Steps the 1st week of March 2010. We were given a small room in the annex section of the hotel which is a 3 minute walk away from the hotel....I know, unbelievable! The hotel should make guests very aware of this as it didnt feel like we were staying in a hotel at all and didn't use any of the hotel facilities which includes a bar and roof top dining area, such a shame! The room itself was clean but very hot, which would of be awful in summer months! Its incredibly central and we went to a fantastic local restaurant called Nino's around the corner from the inn at The Spanish Steps which feels as if nothing has changed much since the 1940's, beautiful dining room, wood paneling and the food was very authentic....go for the house white, fantastic and get the hotel you stay at to book as its very busy! We were relieved when the all Italian menu was swapped for an English one! Rome is incredible and we didn't let a shoddy hotel spoil it....Melanie Evans

Reviews.Title: “Our family loved the Inn at the Spanish Steps!”
Reviews.Author: edward_engalls
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and reserved a family room at the inn. That room category was available on their web site and it was a good choice! The family room is composed of two connecting rooms and this allowed me and my wife to have our own privacy and look after our kids at the same time. It's the ideal option if you travel with the whole family! Both rooms were spacious and clean. Reservation department is very efficient: they sent us several e-mails to confirm the reservation and gave us useful suggestions for restaurant reservations and tours. We booked through them a private tour and our kids fell in love with the guide! She was fantastic! Each staff member was always smiling and attentive to our needs (and believe me.. with 3 kids we had a long list of requests...). In few words... wonderful service, beautiful property and strategic location!!

Reviews.Title: ““Hidden gem in Rome””
Reviews.Author: paulj1958
Reviews.Content: We were planning to visit Rome for years now, and finally this year we did it! We booked online in the very last minute, and had to say we didn’t expect something so nice! This little “Inn” is something amazing, the staff at the reception is so polite and always available! They gave us advices on where to eat, how to jump long queues at the Vatican, booked our airport transfers too…, etc. We had our little puppy with us, he was also very welcome, they also organised a dog-sitter while we were to visit the Vatican. But the best was our executive room, the bed so comfortable! Sure be back one day, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Ultra centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: gracewintry
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at The Inn at the Spanish steps over Christmas and New Years and I had a wonderful stay, apart from the fact the hotel is ultra centrally located, the room was beautiful and the staff really exceptional. We had a perfect Christmas vacation in Rome and the restaurant that the Hotel Concierge chose for us for New Years Eve dinner ( Gaetano Costa restaurant ) was the best restaurant we ever eaten at in all our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Thought a perfect say with kids is impossible?”
Reviews.Author: Bigfamilyinrome
Reviews.Content: So did we. This was the first time me and my husband decided to take our three children of the ages two, five and seven on a trip outside the states. Rome is a busy and hectic place to have chosen but has also always been a dream of mine to visit. The flight was a little hard and we were already feeling a little uneasy about our decision until we got to the Inn and saw that the hotel would have made things a lot better. It is a little hidden nook on one of the most important and beautiful street in Rome, like a little amazing "nest" for us to retreat in. We had two spacious, comfortable, and most of all very clean connecting rooms.This allowed our kids to be kids whilst at the same time we got to relax and enjoy our own space. The breakfast and afternoon meals were very good and offered a wide range of typical italian, or american food which was also great for the picky eaters.. Lastly the staff was very friendly and extremely helpfull when it came to organizing travelling and visitng the city with kids. They would order us cars, or tell us the most conveniant roots to take to entertainment suitable for both us adults and our kids. Overall this hotel is a real gem and helped make our trip exactly what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Loved the studio room...”
Reviews.Author: marthybedd
Reviews.Content: Despite what I read about the annex, I have decided to book the Studio Room at the Inn at the Spanish Steps 'cause it was a great deal indeed. I made the reservation through their official web site and reservation department was so efficient that after 40 minutes only I had my confirmation with a detailed description of my room! I had already saw some pictures on the web though, and upon check in I had the same exact room. The studio is located in one of their annex buildings. I liked that room cause I was totally independent! I had my "private home" in Rome and could anyway take advantage of hotel services. The room was clean and well decorated, internet access and flat TV. Cherry on top: the private kitchenette! Will come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: LaBelleNaples
Reviews.Content: The reviewer who said location is everything was correct. We checked in for a Sat and Sun and received the second to last room in the main building. The site we booked through promised an upgrade but the staff offered us one at 100 euro more/per night. Our room was small, noisy and warm; bathroom was cramped - could not even keep toiletries in it. It was at the back of the building facing the courtyard. Due to renovation scaffolding covered the windows so we could not sleep safely with the window open. Our room was under the kitchen so we heard EVERY noise and smell as breakfast was prepared. It was also next to the elevator which was very noisy in the room. We spent two sleepless nights here. Our booking site did contact the hotel after our return. Management response was "So sorry" - nothing more. This room should not be sold to anyone - make it a storage closet. The positives were the location and breakfast. Skip the afternoon buffet, especially if you need to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: atti_45
Reviews.Content: I started organising our trip to Rome as a surprise present for my wife, for our 20th wedding anniversary. I had to deal with all the little details on my own in secret, but the staff of this hotel was so nice to help me organising everything from the pick-up to the transfer, also sightseeing tours and restaurants booked in advanced... I really wanted the best for us to relax but at the same time, see as much as possible of this marvellous city. Our room was spacious and really beautiful, with modern furniture, and we had our own terrace too – it was so nice sitting there in the evening with our cocktails and just watching the people hanging around the Spanish steps! I want to thank the whole staff of the Inn at the Spanish Steps for being so nice with us and making everything so unforgettable! Highly recommend this hotel to everyone!! Judit & Attila, Szeged Feleségemnek szánt meglepetésként kezdtem el tervezni a római utunkat, 20. házassági évfordulónk alkalmából, igy minden apró részletröl nekem kellett gondoskodnom titokban. Szerencsére a hoteltöl rengeteg segitséget kaptam, nemcsak a pickup és transzfer megszervezésében, hanem különbözö városnézö túrák és éttermek foglalása terén is... Mindenképpen a pihenés volt elötérben amellett, hogy minél többet lássunk ebböl a csodaszép városból. A szobánk tágas volt és valóban lenyügözö, modern bútorokkal, söt, saját terasszal – esténként koktéljainkkal a kézben innen figyeltük a Spanyol lépcsönél lézengö embereket! Ezúton is szeretném megköszönni a hotel teljes személyzetének hogy ilyen kedvesek és segitökészek voltak velünk, és hogy ezáltal felejthetetlenné tették római tartòzkodásunkat! Tiszta szivböl ajánljuk mindenkinek ezt a hotelt. Judit & Attila, Szegedröl

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Cocoreb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel ourselves and were always dealing with the hotel's front desk. We were given an upgrade to a room facing the street which was fun because we could watch the people on the Spanish Steps. The roof top deck was a beautiful place to have breakfast and an afternoon glass of wine with appetizers. The staff were attentive to all our needs and questions. I would definitiely recommend this hotel to women traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “tucked away in the perfect nook”
Reviews.Author: Fabiolaabu
Reviews.Content: We arrived to this hotel unsure of what we would find. It was booked for us last minute through our travel agent. Upon entering through a narrow hallway we felt wary of what kind of hotel it may have been. However upon being shown up into our room a few flights up we found a spacious room with a view of Bvlgari and Gucci on via condoli. The staff was very helpful and were happy to point us towards the sights we were interested in. Our bedroom and bathroom we very nice and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: FSHphd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at the Spanish Steps for three nights. The staff is markedly professional, the food delicious, and location spectacular. Our room was rather small but very well appointed, and the atmosphere is elegant. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The heart of Rome with a View”
Reviews.Author: DaleneM4
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the View at the Spanish steps, an annex to the Inn a view times already. It.s only a few rooms with a stunning view over the Spanish steps. The rooms are comfartable, the food excellent and the view one of the best in Rome. The location is also excellent. The sounds from Via Condotti is rising to the top in a soft whisper, which add to the Roman experience of Spirits gone by!

Reviews.Title: “Now Wait a Minute!”
Reviews.Author: wrantar
Reviews.Content: No disagreement with other guest' s positive comments on location and staff. However, no one seems to have mentioned several negatives that may be deal breakers for some travelers. Comments based on my four night stay booked as classic twin beds @ €200 that was upgraded to twin bed superior. The room was a cramped 10' x 15'. The bath had a dangerous – toilet facing bidet setup that narrowed the tub/shower access to approximately 2 feet. This configuration combined with no grab bars and a wet floor surface made for a for hazardous access. English language television is limited to "European" CNN, which outside the US is heavy on recycled Ammanpour and Blitzer et al, and light on US or international news. Be advised of the elevator and stair situation. A slow speed single 3 person elevator services passengers and baggage creating significant delays at checkout and check-in times. Regarding the stairway's, there are 9 stair steps from street to entry and first elevator access, then, 6 stairs down steps to reception and then the climb back to the elevator landing. The elevator stops only between floors (where there are no rooms) so there are another 9 stair steps to your room floor. Lastly, there are 19 stair steps to breakfast room (plus another 9 stair steps if you are not staying on the top floor and have to climb to it in order to access the 19 steps to breakfast room. No active fire sprinkler system was visible and staff could not point out an active fire suppression system. A significant life safety issue. Noise coming through old-style single pane windows may keep some light sleepers awake. Request a rear courtyard room with the negative being absolutely no view.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: matthdennn
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend some days in Rome to buy all our Christmas's presents and we've booked a room at the Inn at the Spanish Steps. We bought their Last Second offer on the internet; their booking engine is simple and fast and they have a wide room selection and several room rates. With the last second we've got a special discount and it was good 'cause we spent a reasonable amount for a very nice room facing via Condotti, the most famous shopping street in Rome. We can't believe we've just at the Spanish Steps! Location is perfect and the staff is superb! Everybody is professional and smiling, both at the front desk and at the breakfast room. We had a positive experience and we highly recommend it to couples!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mkg623
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thorougly enjoyed our stay at the Inn. The room far surpassed our expectations. It was big, as was the bathroom. The service was outstanding. Everyone was very nice and helpful. The location was a plus and minus. The Spanish Stairs and via Condatti is a great place to be. It's in the center of everything and you can walk everywhere. However, the area is very busy and can be very noisy. The only downside to the hotel is that I was kept awake one night by the street noise. All in all, for the value, service and location, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Near-luxury with side view of Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: obsoperator
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it's widely recommended-even making it into Frommer's Rome. I noticed on their web site that they also have an annex building, so it would be helpful if someone could review that as well. We were in the main building, Room 305, which looks out on Via dei Condotti. They said it was an upgrade from the Deluxe Double Room I had booked on the web for 319 Euros (including breakfasts for 2) plus 10% tax per night. It was clear to me that the 30-day advance booking price (with deposit) was going to go up after the 30-day deadline, so I went ahead and booked. They told us that they were full-up by the time we got there. Internet was 15 Euros for two days, very high speed. (This was essential for grabbing the last Borghese gallery tickets available!) This is a small hotel, with a hardworking, dedicated staff. There's an elevator, but it's impossible to avoid all the stairs. Although breakfast in your room is available, there's no way to reach the beautiful rooftop bar and breakfast terrace without climbing stairs. Those with bad knees, etc., should consider staying elsewhere. We had no complaint ourselves. The room was attractive and clean, if not more spacious than the average midrange european hotel. That is, we had a desk, but you had to push the chair in to get by when going around the huge bed-bigger than kingsize. There was one window with double glass. You could hear the garbage trucks, the noisiest things on the street, although you could not hear the crowds of tourists at all. We slept fine.The bathroom (with Jacuzzi that we didn't use) was more spacious, modern, and attractive. Like much of Italy, there's no shower curtain, but a glass partition kept 99% of the shower water in the tub. I strongly recommend that you stay here three nights, because you probably will then qualify for a free airport car pickup. We paid 55 Euros, and we enjoyed the luxury after a two-segment flight from the US. But because we were meeting a cruise ship, there was no way to stay more than 2 nights. The car to the Civitavecchia cruise port was 150 Euros (!), but that's the going rate for a trip three times as far as the airport, and no hope of a fare back for the driver. The managers also made two restaurant reservations for us in advance. We were pleased with all the staff we met. When the weather is wet, the breakfast room can be crowded, since many are reluctant to sit under the (huge) umbrellas on the terrace. An evening glass of wine (very reasonably priced) with complimentary heavy hors d'oeuvres is magnificent in the sunset. You have to look over the edge of the roof, and turn your head to see the Spanish Steps, however. (I'm not whining, just a matter of truth in advertising.) The location is excellent for attractions on this side of Rome. In particular, the Borghese and Barberini Galleries are walkable, as is The Trevi Fountain We did a sightseeing walk home from the Castel Sant'Angelo, through Piazza Navona, to the Pantheon, and the Trevi Fountain. But not everyone would want to walk that far. The Coliseum and ancient Rome are actually a shorter distance from the hotel than that walk added up to. Walking was cool in October, but you might want to use the Spagna subway stop on a sweltering summer day. I can't recommend the hotel at the full rack rate, but if you can get a discount, it's a worthwhile splurge. The rooms are not quite as charming as the hallways and public rooms, but our room was certainly quiet and comfortable. Our room was in excellent shape, and I wouldn't even describe it as "dated". But the striped and printed fabrics looked like an obsolete style of luxury-decorating. In that sense it wasn't "better" than a glossy modern business hotel interior.

Reviews.Title: “Good but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Tripper099
Reviews.Content: We liked the Hotel. Traditional European townhouse. No facilities other than the roof terrace/bar area and helpful staff. Our room was at the front overlooking Condotti - a tastefully decorated medium sized room with good quality linens. The doble shutters, inside and out, save you from a very noisy crowd in the street at the weekend. the bathroom was of poorer quality, small and dated. Restaurant recommendations are reliable but not inspired - mainly touristy places. You can walk just about everywhere and Rome really is on the doorstep. I would stay there again but, even taking into account sterling's weakness against the euro, it was expensive for what you get. Do book Borghese and the Colosseum in advance but not the Vatican based on our experience. The only place where there were no queues was at the Museum ticket office which covers the Vatican Museum, courtyards and the Sisteine Chapel. And go there early, it is incredibly busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff, Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: WalkingTowardBuddha
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location on Via Condotti just a half block from the Spanish Steps. Ton's of great shopping and restaurants within a few blocks of the front door of the hotel. The staff was really helpful with general assistance and dining recommendations. Very good breakfast bufffet on the top floor with a nice rooftop terrace. The rooms were large and clean but some of them seemed a bit worn and could use a facelift. We were initially in room 205 which is supposed to be a deluxe room facing via Condotti but when we expressed our disappointment with it's general level of upkeep after the first night the front desk person admitted that it was a "sad room" and moved us into a much brighter snd larger room around the corner. Bottom line with this place is location, location, location and the staff was really quite great.

Reviews.Title: “Best Breakfast in The World!”
Reviews.Author: caty3
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay it this very beautiful hotel in Rome. I was so impressed by the friendly service of staff. Big thanks to Francesca and Franco! The Best Breakfast in The World. I've had loads of good breakfasts at beautiful hotels but this breakfast was indeed fit for a queen! I highly recommend you have a night or two here. Right next door is Cafe Greco and you can get take out from there and take it to your room and people watch on the Via Condotti. Two steps away are "The Steps". This hotel is amazing, especially if you like your exclusive hotel very discrete. Thanks again to the Beautiful Inn at the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Book the annex! It's superb!”
Reviews.Author: Tigronerino
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 rooms at the Inn at the Spanish Steps for a long week end in Rome and I have decided to stay in their annex building on Condotti 48. I acknowledged on their web site that they have two annex buildings: one faces the Spanish Steps and it's called the View; the other annex is an apartment of only 4 rooms, on Condotti as well, just few blocks away from the main building. I'd loved staying at the view, but I could not afford the price for those rooms (it's gorgeus! I saw some pictures on the web site and I guess it's really unique...), so I've decided to book the other option. The rooms in the annex are furnished in modern style and had plasma TV. We had the whole apartment for us (I was travelling with my three sisters with our husbands) so we also had a private butler in the morning at our complete disposal for breakfast (which was great! Tasty cappucinos and espresso!) Furthermore..the rates I've got were much lower that the rates for the view! The annex has been our home for some days... and at the same time we had all assistance from the front desk for restaurant suggestions, tours... The Inn at the Spanish Steps with its annex is my new favourite place in Rome! I recommend it to all of you!!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: nerinotino
Reviews.Content: We've just back after a short stay in Rome... and we can't wait to go there again! For sure we'll choose again the Inn at the Spanish Steps! The room we had was amazing, with canopy bed and plasma TV!! It also had a small balcony and we could see the spanish steps on our left hand side... we made the reservation on their web site because there was a last minute offer available, it was a deal! The front desk staff is friendly and it's nice to have people calling you by name! it makes you feel at home and not just a client.. Everything was walking distance and after shopping it's good to enjoy the snack buffet.. the barman (Shucri was his name...) is great! It was not our first time in Rome, but the Inn at the Spanish Steps is for sure the best place we've been.. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: bab231
Reviews.Content: The Inn at the Spanish Steps is a wonderful place to stay. It is a hidden gem that is tucked away behind many upscale shops and it feels like home from the minute that you walk in the door. The staff is extremely helpful and our room, while small, was extremely clean and absolutely perfect for us. The rooftop deck is beautiful and relaxing and the complimentary happy hour snacks are a wonderful perk. This inn should not be missed on your next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service”
Reviews.Author: Rbos1
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few nights at The Inn at Spanish Steps during a recent trip to Rome. If you want to do some high end shopping (or browsing) - you're on the right street. Boutique hotel was funky but historic at the same time. Breakfast was amazing and they had a great happy hour type thing on the roofdeck with appetizers that I thought was a really nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing abt this hotel is location”
Reviews.Author: PirateprincessX
Reviews.Content: Inn At the Spanish Steps is right in the middle of Rome's shopping high streets. If you are into shopping or even just window shopping/people watching, this is probably one of the best locations you can ask for. We also can walk to most of the famous tourism sites from the hotel. But that's probably what I like the most about this hotel. The room was a bit small, dark and tired-looking, in my opinion. The staffs are generally quite friendly. Franco (receptionist) is excellent and very helpful. Overall, I will give about 70/100 for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family reunion at the Inn at the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: levittsandra
Reviews.Content: I have found the Inn at the Spanish Steps while searching a hotel in Rome and I've chosen it because they offered a very good deal for mini groups...we had a special discount because we've booked 5 rooms on their web site. I booked immediately for me and my family. My partents and my sister live in US while my brother works in Australia so we meet each other only once a year... and this year we've decided to spend a week all together n Rome... I highly recommend the Inn at the Spanish Steps! They reserved for us the annex building located just two blocks away from the main building and we felt like home! the annex has 4 double rooms: a private apartment for us!! The rooms we had are modern with plasma tv, even if we did not used it so much... how could one watch tv while being in Rome... ? We have been pumpered by the staff.. they booked for us restaurants for each day and I can say now that Italian cuisine is really the best! We enjoyed our experience there so much and can't wait to go back to the Inn... maybe next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Sales in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: beckyspenck
Reviews.Content: I have spent some days in Rome in occasion of the summer sales (....). it was hot.. but we enjoyed so much our short break in that beautiful city! Thanks to all the staff of the Inn at the Spanish Steps! Shukri the barman... Fabio and Franco at the Front desk: their restaurant suggestions were perfect! The room we have been assigned was a classic room facing the courtyard and it was so quite that I could not believe I was in the very city centre!! Shopping was great cause all the main shops are just there... in a few words: a wonderful experience! I highly recommend it and I'll go back there for winter sales :-) becky

Reviews.Title: “Appearances can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: nicoledu_9
Reviews.Content: Before our arrival the hotel booked us car service and provided restaurant recommendations. The service appeared to be superb. When we arrive it was an entirely different story. The first night we went to one of the restaurants recommended - it was so awful that we left in the middle of dinner! How can you have an awful dinner in Rome? They placed us in apartments a few blocks from the hotel, it seemed fine, but then the power went out. And did not get turned back on. We requested a new room or even a flashlight and were provided with neither on the first night. Finally, they moved us to a new room...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: MStierle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the inn for two nights at the end of our twelve day trip to Italy. We were hot, tired, and ready for home, but the Inn was wonderfully relaxing for a hotel in Rome! I had stayed in Rome several times and never liked the hotels. The Inn was a welcome change from what I was expecting. The rooms were quaint,clean, and cool, but not brand new. We enjoyed the location, so close to the Spanish Steps, the subway, and shopping. We ate both nights in little wine bars in the immediate area and were pleased with the food. The Inn has a cocktail hour from 5-8pm with complimentary appetizers that should not be missed. It is up on the rooftop terrace, with spectacular views and yummy foods (for free!). My husband and I would have been miserable if we were not happy with our hotel at the end of a wonderful, but long trip. The Inn was the perfect Rome hotel in my opinion and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico!”
Reviews.Author: Roxanne4Miller
Reviews.Content: I choose an Italian word to say that the Inn at the Spanish Steps is simply unique... if you want to feel not just a tourist, you shall stay there! All the staff has been extremely helpful and they gave me very good restaurant suggestions. Actually my boyfriend took care of the hotel reservation cause it's been his present for my birthday.. and I really never forget it.. We had a room in the annex building... fantastic!! Thank you Inn at the Spanish Steps

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: travelinfool101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in May. The hotel was in the perfect location - we walked everywhere - even to the Vatican and Colloseum - everything was easy to get to and not a far walk at all. The hotel was very clean and modern - perfect for our tastes. The courtyard upstairs was beautiful with lush flowers and trees all around - made us feel like we were eating breakfast in a lovely garden every morning. The staff were fabulous as well and advised us on excellent dinners each night. We felt they sent us to true Italian restaurants and not just some chain restaurant which was offering a bonus to the hotel for the referral - they were truly amazing Italian dinners - especially restaurante 59 - off the beaten path and the best service and food in Rome. Thanks again Spanish Steps!!

Reviews.Title: “Intimate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulH1967
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely May short break in Rome and stayed at the lnn @ the Spansih Steps Hotel. It is located rght on the Via Conotti with all the glam shops. The hotel is very intimate and romantic with a super terrace from where you can saviour the rooftops of rome. We had a executive room with a huge comfy bed. The room was a delight and had nice touches such as fruit, bottled water and nuts. The staff were very attentive and professional and made us very welcome. We opted for a chauffeur serviceto and from the airport for 120 euro. An expensive transfer but we wanted to arrive in style. It was a pity about the return chauffeur service as we were driven to the airport in a clapped out peugeot with no air-con and stinking of smoke! I did complain and was refunded 30 euro. I would advise to check type of vehicle if you opt for this service. The hotel booked fine restaurants for us and the breakfasts were extremely nice. You could also have a complimentary buffet food on the terrace in the afternoon which was a real treat. This is an expensive hotel and Rome is an expensive city! But we had an amazing and exhausting time! The location is ideal for seeing all the sites and we walked pretty much everywhere. Grab a map, take your time and see all the sites taht Rome as to offer.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice week end...”
Reviews.Author: Priscilla72
Reviews.Content: Dear all! If you are planning your trip to Rome choose The Inn at the Spanish Steps! I have been there with my friends just a couple of weeks ago and I would immediately come back there... A perfect location for everything: shops, monuments, restaurants.. all is walking distance.. We went to Rome for shopping and could not be better located that there! Just be aware not to spend all your money :-) We received an upgrade to two superior adjoining rooms and we had breakfast on the terrace, between lemon trees and colourful flowers.... simply amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: denaza
Reviews.Content: Lovely Boutique Hotel..Rooms felt like a mini mansion..brocade lined walls, painted ceilings. Great location for strolling to the sights. Surrounded by restaurants and shops galore. The hot breakfast was wonderful with alot of variety. We were pleasantly surprised with a feature we were not aware of..At 5:00pm a fabulous antipasto table is presented on the rooftop. Free laptop brought to our room was appreciated.The staff was great. Everything at the Inn was done with class!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: theschneids
Reviews.Content: What an amazing, quaint hotel! The location cannot be beat! The Spanish Steps, which is the most central location in Rome, was right in front of you. The roof-top terrace alone was amazing....breakfast every morning was delicious as was the complimentary snack buffet between 5pn and 8pm. The staff was very attentive - they were able to secure us a Saturday night reservation in a very popular restaurant for our 10th Anniversary! Cannot say enough! Just a word of advice....they do not supply wash clothes, but none of the Rome hotels do..so, if you are like me and need a wash cloth, bring a couple of your own! Enjoy.....WELL WORTH the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Families. Superb location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: SolveigReykjavik
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome where me and my family spent a week at The Inn at the Spanish Steps. We were very pleased with this hotel. The location is superb right in via Dei Condotti, the center of shopping in Rome and just a few steps from the Spanish Steps. Easy to walk everywhere, charming place. We booked the Inn taking advantage of the special family offer (we are two adults and three children of 2, 7 and 14). Two of my children got free!!! Thanks to the site in Icelandic language we were able to book it very easily. We will book again if we will return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Well done! I will be back ,Takk fyrir.”
Reviews.Author: jonsson_ingi
Reviews.Content: After I had booked this hotel I have to say that I was a little concerned about the cost wich in this period of economy crises is not a second issue but I have to tell you that it was exceptional for a wide variety of reasons ... location, service, rooms, roof terrace, staff... all amazing. We checked in on a Friday evening after a very loooong flight and were upgraded to an executive room with a small balcony overlooking the Spanish Steps. The canopy bed was very confortable.. Bathroom had jacuzzi tub, shower, separate area for the commode and two sinks which made getting ready in the morning a breeze. The breakfast buffet on the roof terrace which was included in our room rate was delicious. All the espresso and cappucino you can drink. Fresh baked pastries, and American breakfast items like eggs and bacon. When I return to Rome I'll stay here again without a second thought.It is worth every Krona.Takk fyrir!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful find!”
Reviews.Author: Betera
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from five days at The Inn at the Spanish Steps. We were so happy we sent a thank you note to the hotel. After changing rooms (they were very helpful) we found ourselves in a sunny, cozy, antique filled room with a good amount of space and some lovely touches (fireplace, beamed ceilings). A note--the street is lively and noisy. Great for walking on but not for having a room above. The windows shut out the noise, but if you like an open window, day or night, ask for a room facing the back. The location of the Inn is perfect, right in the center of shopping and endless trattorias/ristorantes, not to mention the obvious (the Spanish Steps right down the block) The concierge service is perfect. Franco, in particular, was most helpful, suggesting wonderful places to dine. The entire staff is friendly, polite and very professional. We were delighted with their help and most appreciative. Our favorite part of the Inn was the upstairs breakfast nook/lounge area. A lovely buffet breakfast (included) is served as you sit on comfortable couches and arm chairs (or outdoors, under umbrellas in warmer weather.) An early evening free buffet is offered as well, and provides an opportunity to meet and chat with other guests. We found the Inn via Tripadvisor, so thanks to all who recommended it before me. Much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful find!”
Reviews.Author: Betera
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from five days at The Inn at the Spanish Steps. We were so happy we sent a thank you note to the hotel.
