Much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELADIX
Reviews.Content: Loved every minute of it! Beautiful hotel with friendly staff & a great location. A little on the expensive side. Best breakfast room in the whole city.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality five star hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: harrybruce
Reviews.Content: I have been in many hotels in rome during my life, never was so good. Great location, excellent staff, wonderfull view., really nice room with canopy bed. I will be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: johnbruno6
Reviews.Content: I was at the inn at the spanish steps in december with my friend to celebrate my birthday. We found a very good hotel, great location, friendly staff, excellent breakfast, nice room. My best hotel experience, we will suggest it. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn at the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: Jaxy74
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have just come back from a 3 night stay at the Inn at the Spanish Steps. Overall the stay was excellent. The staff were very helpful and accommodating and we were delighted to also receive a free room upgrade. Breakfast was very pleasant in the lounge area (sadly it rained all weekend so we had no chance to have breakfast out on the pretty terrace.) The bedroom was very spacious, clean and stylish. The bathroom was a little small and the jacuzzi did not work but hey - we had received a free room upgrade so we didn't complain. We had a view of Bulgari and Gucci which was great and an oblique view of the Spanish Steps. The location was perfect, right at the top of the glamourous Condotti. The only minus point would be the bed. It looked amazing, was huge with loads of cushions but the mattress was very hard. Saying that, I would stay there again and also recommend it. Its a shame however that with the pound to euro rate, Rome works out to be an expensive city break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cirrichard
Reviews.Content: The Inn is one of the best value luxury hotels in Rome. The service was great. The rooms are large for Rome and the beds are huge. There is a garden lounge open for a late afternoon cocktail and the Inn supplies a great spread of appetizers. The view is great and it is quiet and intimate. The same lounge is where a great breakfast is served, including bacon and eggs (IN ROME). The best asset of the Inn is the service. This is a small establishment that treats you personally and professionally. From all the reviews that I read on Trip Advisor of Rome hotels and our past experiences, the large 5 star hotels do not compare to this Inn. I recommend it highly and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, & staff”
Reviews.Author: jvbi
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with a great location and possibly the best , friendliest staff ever. It is also a good deal for the area, right on the Via Condotti, a very fancy shopping street. We stayed at their annex , still on Via Condotti but a few blocks further from the Spanish Steps. The annex was very quiet, and has bigger rooms than the main hotel. We spent several late afternoons / early evenings having a drink in the main hotel's terrace lounge. They serve free hors d'oevres - seriously, that's a deal in Rome where everything is so ruinously expensive. Outside overlooking the skyline and reputedly the designer Valentino's apartment, or inside the cozy lounge, it was wonderful place to hang out. The staff could not be friendlier or more helpful. I used a staffer's laptop since I didn't have my own. Need anything? Just ask and they perform with smiles. Truly, the entire staff work really hard to ensure their guests are comfortable and happy. If we go back to Rome, we would definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “three unforgettable days”
Reviews.Author: francy0oxford
Reviews.Content: I've been for three days in this small but very pretty hotel in Rome. So near to the romantic Spanish Steps and the most famous shops in Via Condotti. The staff was professional and also friendly. My husband and I have been so impressed of how they helped us to find everithing we needed: good restaurants and the tour into the city. Our room was comfortable, the stile modern and in the same time warm. TV with a lot of international channels, king bed and a small terrace in front of Via Condotti. Also the terrace were we had breakfast every day was characteristic and familiar. We had the chance to visit one of the most famous city and also to live three unforgettable days in a great atmosphere in a romantic location. Rose

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ich_8
Reviews.Content: great hotel, top service and good location of hotel, we had a great stay at the inn

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I love it”
Reviews.Author: ClaGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Owesome property, Ideal location to visit the city and for the shopping. The hotel is located in Spanish steps, the heart of Rome, crucial place for the shopping (my wife love it) with the major brands all around within few steps. To visit the major attractions you no need to go anywhere else you are already there! The Staff of the Hotel,extremly helpfull, will drive you throught your personal experience in the city. By using their tips when the evening will come you wll be already under the spell of one of the most beautifull city in the world. Coming back at the hotel i found romantic the view on the spanish steps late a night. Overall good value for the money. I will certenelly come back.

Reviews.Title: “If the bed is uncomfortable.....”
Reviews.Author: seetheuniverse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about location. If you want to stay within the shopping triangle, surrounded by glamour and glitz, this is the place for you. Nestled next to Prada, you couldn't ask for a better spot. One block from the metro and walking distance to most of the sights. However, when I come back from a day of shopping and sightseeing, and am paying as much as I am for a night in a hotel, I want a comfortable bed. What I got was several nights of sleeping on a box spring, with coils sticking me every time I moved. After I was told my room rate was being increased for the weekend, I complained bitterly to the staff. I was given a withering look and told the beds were "orthopedic beds". Whatever that means. They placed a foam pad on the bed which helped to cushion the springs but I was rather disappointed overall with the size of the room, the furnishings and the amenities. I paid half as much for a room (that was also next door to Prada) in Florence and slept much more comfortably. Research your options and instead of paying through the nose for this hotel, find a cheaper place so you have money to shop with!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor value, great location”
Reviews.Author: JMHKansas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at the Spanish Steps in late August. Their driver was waiting for us at the airport as promised, which was nice after an 11 hour flight. Upon arrival at our hotel we were informed that because another guest had to change their travel dates (due to a sick baby - long story about hospitilization ensued), our room was not available but we would be put in the Inn's "small apartment" for the night. We were so exhausted at that point we agreed. After a 3 block walk lugging our suitcases over cobbled streets, we colapsed on the rock hard bed in our little apartment. After a freezing cold shower (due to poorly functioning boiler) I demanded a new room, and was promised an upgrade the following day. Long story short, we were upgraded, but the experience left a sour taste in our mouth. We would not stay here again, nor would we recommend it to others. The location was great, but beware if you're a light sleeper, as the street noise at night woke me frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with this hotel at all.................”
Reviews.Author: shawnc2
Reviews.Content: I just got home last night from Rome and staying at this hotel, let me just say, only one good thing about it, the location that's it, we were in France,and Italy for 14 days before this and stayed in three other hotels, and this was the only one we did not like. I always look at reviews to make my decision and I just needed to say I did not like the hotel and the service was ok, Franco greeeted us and offered us an upgrade so we took it right over the street, extremely loud all night, so we went back to our original room and cheaper price which he said he would not charge us more for the one night we upgraded but when we checked out he changed his mind. Oh well, I just had to say this, because we wished so much we would have stayed somewhere else.....The whole hotel needs an overhaul, for the price not woth it at all. Even if they did, we would not go back too because of the service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but VERY overpriced”
Reviews.Author: funw3boys
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 1/2 week trip to Florence, Rome, Positano in Italy and Valencia & Barcelona in Spain and New York City with our 3 boys aged 8-12. By far for the price, this was definitely our biggest disappointment. I was very apprehensive to stay here from the beginning because of the $ and I wasn't sure how much time we would actually be staying in our room. The biggest disappointment was we had specifically requested adjoining rooms since we were having 3 children stay in a room by themselves. I said this was a huge deal breaker for us if they could not accommodate us. They said they could but made us upgrade to a 100 euro, more expensive room. Well, I guess there is a little bit of a language difference on what adjoining/connecting rooms mean. These rooms were not connecting but next to each other. I was extremely disappointed. The rooms were fine and they did have the largest king size bed I have ever seen. It had to be 2 doubles pushed together. We could have easily had 4 if not 5 people in our room with the children, but they would only allow 3 max and 1/2 our bed went unused. The breakfast and hors d'oeuvres were good but you had to pay for the drinks including water, so they kind of get you with that. It was a nice idea though and customary in Europe. Also, I was surprised about the other review about the concierge. The one time we got a referral we had asked for something kid friendly and casual with pizza and they sent us to a restaurant with no kids menu or pizza and was fancy. Luckily we were able to find a place right next door! I think there are better options for your money. Now the most luxurious hotel we stayed in was the Westin in Valencia, Spain, now that was comfort AND our cheapest hotel of the trip WITH adjoining rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly Room with Broken Furniture Costs How Much?”
Reviews.Author: mlm125
Reviews.Content: During a month long trip to Italy and Eastern Europe in February 2008, I booked this hotel to celebrate my husband's 32nd birthday as a nice surprise. Although it was the priciest hotel we stayed at during this particular trip, it was one of the least nice properties. After traveling throughout Europe and Asia and staying in all sorts of luxury properties, this one stands out as a big disappointment. I would not stay here again. When I finally saw the room, I was crushed. Not the kind of birthday surprise I was hoping for. We had a room on the second floor that overlooked the street. The room absolutely STANK from smoke and was so must y that every time we walked in the room, we rushed to open the balcony door to provide some relief. Literally, other than while sleeping, we were never in the room without the balcony door open, and in February, this says a lot. Worst of all, some of the furniture in our room was actually broken. The desk drawer had a giant chunk of wood missing. This is fine for a Motel 6, but not for a property like this. Looking at the broken and scratched up furniture just made my heart break. In fairness to the hotel, the breakfast each morning was very nice in terms of selection and quality of food. Although the space where they served the food was lovely, it was very cramped, especially during rush times. The location is nice, too, but the hotel could do a bit more to make its property actually deliver.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: emgtraveller
Reviews.Content: i almost hate to tell people how great this place is. the location is perfect, the breakfast on the roof garden is wonderful. service is very attentive. and we were travelling with a college age child so we had a great room with two beds. and internet of course. loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff keeps this hotel a step ahead of the rest”
Reviews.Author: CHG30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in June 08. Overall our experience was excellent. I really felt this hotel tried to add value to our experience the whole way through our stay. Pre- arrival service with this hotel was AMAZING. Francesca emailed us at least 5 times prior to arriving with many suggestions such as how to pre book attractions to avoid the queues etc. She also pre-booked all our restaurants for the Rome leg of our trip taking into account our preferences. All of the restaurants were excellent. We appreciated the free upgrade to a deluxe room, and the free airport transfer. ( They offer a free one way pick up.) Overall it was these types of little touches that make this hotel a step above the normal tourist hotel. This and the staff who were all superb, from the receptionist to the thoughtful waiter who would bring strawberrys unprompted to accompany a glass of Prosseco! The room itself was large, furnished in typical Italian style with antique furnishings. It was clean, the bed was comfortable, the linen new and in good condition. The room was also very quiet. Breakfast was taken on the roof terrace, a lovely location for breakfast surrounded by lemon and olive trees and a great view over the city. From 5-8 they also serve aperativo on the terrace - a most pleasant way to spend the early evening. Overall excellent hotel, excellent location, superb staff. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: betDublin
Reviews.Content: stayed here on the 9th may for 2 nights. staff, exceptional. location, right on via condotti, was in shopping heaven. have been to rome lots of times, but truely have found a gem of a hotel. rooms, lovely, very clean. hotel terrace a haven of calmness, you wouldnt think you were in the centre of a bustling city. am going back in august & will be staying there

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maya34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 3 nights last week. We were recommended by two different friends, so we thought there should be something at this hotel. There really was... From the moment we entered the hotel, we were met by the staff who were very kind, helpful and positive. We had a very nice room at the other building of the hotel, still on via Condotti. The location is perfect, within walking distance to most of the tourist attractions. We never took a taxi or the metro. The terrace is a little piece of heaven among lemon trees and you can enjoy some complementary food there. It is always possible that some unfortunate things can happen as was mentioned by other people in reviews. But I would highly recommend this little hotel that contributed much to our pleasant stay at Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kna774
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Inn for 3 nights in September as part of our honeymoon. We loved the location, the evening cocktails on the roof and the service was decent. Our room was pretty yet small, but we expected that as we were in Rome. No view. We spent most of the time away from the hotel exploring the city, so the room did its job. I had friends who lived in Rome so I got most of our restaurant recommendations from them. The once place we were sent to by the hotel was incredibly overpriced, very touristy and we got royally ripped-off. We travel often and this place was more like a slap in the face. Our trip to Rome was excellent and at the time I thought the hotel was great and I couldn't wait to tell others to go there. After leaving Rome we flew to Mykonos. While unpacking at that hotel, we noticed that my husband left some of his dress shirts at the Inn at the Spanish Steps. I immediately called the hotel (we had checked out earlier that morning) and was told that I needed to fax over my credit card information so that they could send me back the shirts. I said, you have my info from this morning and I wouldn't send it over again. They wouldn't send me the shirts - not to Greece and to the States. Got in touch with my travel agent (while still on my honeymoon) to get her people on it. It is now May '08 and I still do not have those shirts. For a hotel that is supposed to be to high-end and cater to people, I was incredibly surprised at their behavior. I have never had issues like this before.

Reviews.Title: “A tale of two stays: one decent, one dreadful”
Reviews.Author: ncinaz
Reviews.Content: We recently had two stays at the Inn at the Spanish Steps and the experiences couldn't have been more different. The Inn's billing works in mysterious ways. We booked the stay several months in advance and were surprised to be immediately charged for the entire stay. When I inquired with the hotel via e-mail, they explained that the charge was just an authorization and would expire within two weeks, which it did. A few weeks before our arrival I checked the hotel's website to see if rates had gone down since the initial reservation. They had gone down dramatically, from 390 euro to 250 euro per night. Again, I contacted the hotel and they agreed to reduce the rate. Finding the hotel once you arrive in Rome isn't easy, it's hidden away and has only a tiny sign leading through a drab hallway to a small office - don't expect a lobby. The front desk personnel were warm and helpful on our initial two-night stay. Our room, in the "View," on the top floor of a separate building, was relatively modern and had a lovely view over the Spanish Steps. Unfortunately, the ruckus from the Steps caused us a lot of lost sleep. The bed was more suited to a one-star hotel than one that commands nearly 400 euro a night. Nevertheless, we enjoyed the location, the wonderful terraces, and the friendly staff. We returned to Rome a few days later after a visit to Positano and the truly first-rate Le Sirenuse. We were greeted at the front desk with indifference and the staffer who had been helpful on the prior visit was quite unpleasant. We were stunned to learn that our room would cost the mysterious price of 340 euro, not the 250 the hotel agreed to, and not the initial 390. The front desk attendant said he had no record of the 250 rate and refused to honor it unless I had proof (even though we had just stayed there a few days prior). I emailed him the correspondence that mentioned the 250 rate and he said that only the manager could reduce the rate and we could discuss it when we checked out early the next morning. As it turned out the manager never appeared that morning, just a night attendant. Then there was the matter of our room on the second stay. This room, in the "Inn" proper, was small, dark, dingy, had no view whatsoever. The horrendous bed in that room made us nostalgic for the other lousy bed. The coup de gras was that our wake-up call the morning of check-out was a half-hour late. Our follow-up emails to the hotel haven't been returned. One last thing to be aware of - the hotel plays fast and loose with your credit card information. Expect them to take a huge authorization on your card and hold it for several weeks while also charging you for the stay once you check out. Apologies for the long message. I just thought potential guests should be aware of all the issues at the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: girl506
Reviews.Content: The inn at the Spanish steps was quite lovely. The rooms were fairly large, clean. Most staff members speak english, and were very friendly. The location is conveniently located to anywhere you're going in the city. On via Condotti,where most luxury boutiques are situated. It was a pleasant stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kcpf1121
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Rome we had a reservation for a different hotel. Due to the condition of that hotel we had to change. My travel agent suggested the Inn at the Spanish steps. From the manager (Franco) down to the service staff I have never stayed at a hotel where the staff was so helpful. The hotel was immaculate! If you are expecting a great room entrance you have the wrong place. They make up for it though in every other aspect of the hotel. The size of the room was big enough that coming back to the room to relax was entirely possible. If you wanted to check your e-mail the staff sent up a laptop so you could do so in private. Not only did your stay include breakfast but also an evening snack, both of which were excelent. With so much to see and do in Rome, we left feeling as if we didn't spend enough time in the Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: HonestTravelerNJ
Reviews.Content: What people are saying in the reviews are true. It's a quaint small boutique with the friendliest staff! We were upgraded to a larger room without asking. The bathroom was very large and modern and the bed was huge (a little hard but I found most beds in Europe are this way). It turned out there was construction on the street outside our window one night and the staff gladly moved us to a new room at the rear of the hotel. I have to say the rooftop lounge was a great perk. When you want to rest your feet from touring and don't want to sit in your room, it's a nice place to go. They provide a free early evening buffet with snacks and small sandwiches and great breakfast with eggs, pastries, toast, cereal, etc. What made this hotel amazing was mostly the location and the amazing staff. I would recommend it to anyone. It is worth the price. (also, it might be worth checking out the new hotel the owner opened called The Inn at the Roman Forum. We spoke with the owner one day and it sounded nice).

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Jason_Suzanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn having booked it at short notice. We had heard that the staff there were excellent and thoroughly helpful. This certainly turned out to be the case. They arranged a fantastic tour of the Vatican (with Kim) and changed our room when we noted the temporary road works to improve the pathway outside. The location was also superb and felt very safe. The complimentary evening buffet is also excellent and the free internet service very useful. We would recommend this place to prospective travellers - you definitely get what you pay for in Rome and this place is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: clifton2a
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, There is no doubt the location is great location we were upgraded to the view which is the top floor of a building overlooking the Spanish steps and 10 doors away from the main hotel it has a private terrace and living room which is shared by the 3 bedrooms breakfast is served on the terrace each morning, The unsual thing was that you had to go to the hotel to let you in the building everytime you came back which was a real nuisance also as it wasn't in the hotel room service etc took a while. They don't have Irons either and it's quite expensive to get shirts pressed !! The rooms was a nice size and the bathroom had a Jacuzzi all in all it's a great location can be a bit noisy but when you close the shutters it's fine ( have to expect it for the location) we spent most of our time sightseeing and were able to walk everywhere, The staff were great and Franco booked us some nice places to eat and was great at giving directions, The little gifts in your room eveyday was a nice touch. If you do go to Rome you should try and get to BABY in Hotel Aldrovandi Palace we had the tasting menu here and it is one of the best meals I have ever had for food and service [--] The hotel provided a car to pick us up from the airport and ordered a taxi for us to go back it was meant to only cost 45 but the driver tryed to get 56 when we got there he finally settled for 50 Obviously this wasn't the hotels fault but just beware Great hotel, Great location but don't expect 5* service

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place”
Reviews.Author: ItalyfanEngland
Reviews.Content: Mike and Frances Wedge, England My husband and I stayed at the Inn at the Spanish Steps from 20th June for 3 nights. We also asked the hotel limousine to collect us from and return us to Rome airport, which saved a lot of hassle and the service was first class. Staff at the Inn were always courteous, polite and discrete. The waiters who look after the roof terrace are charming and cannot do enough for guests. Our 'favourite' waiter was an Iraqi, married to a Croat, who spoke Italian and English with an American accent. Great! He was charm personified. The roof terrace really is a little haven away from the busy streets below and what a view of the Spanish Steps (especially first thing in the morning). Location-wise this hotel could not be better, surrounded by super restaurants and even (good) walking distance to the Forum. We would recommend the use of taxis rather than the Metro - they are relatively cheap, airconditioned and you get chance to see more of Rome (if sometimes slowly). Each night from 5 pm the hotel serves a super buffet on the terrace - a word of advice - get there early as our friends from over the Atlantic are fond of their food and it can be cleared out relatively quickly! Further advice - if you want to visit the Colosseum, get tickets on line in advance and avoid the 30 minute queues. Further advice - don't fly into Fiumicino airport - on return we arrived 3.5 hours early and only just managed to catch our planes. There were 3 american jumbos leaving but all departures had to queue in a main queue before checking in at relevant desks. It was a nightmare. also, hire a car from central Rome not at the airport - this queue was 2 hours long! (Avis). We shall return to the Inn - it is now one of our most favoured hotels in the world. Our room was spacious and well furnished with a HUGE bed and stuccoed ceilings. Each day we had a little 'gift' from the hotel - a lovely touch.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever stayed - and that for 1200 Euros per night!!”
Reviews.Author: JapanLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was truly disgusting - I do not comprehend the lack of taste and investment of the owner while having the audacity to charge 12K Euros per room per night! As the Suite was gone, I booked the 'second best' choice , according to the hotel, for my parents' 50th anniversary. The room turned out to be mouldy and grim (without any old charm) decorated with dust covered cheap synthetic flowers dated from mid 80s at least ( !), the so called 'jacuzzi' was old , scratchy, and filthy, the bath amenities were less than the 2nd rate, the corridors were filled with revolting 'synthetic' cheap scent often used in some hideous toilet in a dim backstreet cafe, and the terrace where breakfast was served was again filthy with pigeons flocking on the plates on tables that guests had left. No waiter/waitress bothered to chase the pigeons away or clear the mess. The breakfast was equally distasteful with the highlight of tinned fruit and cheapest packaged chesse. In Italy! The following morning we moved to the Hotel Eden on the hill - thank God the hotel was excellent and the staff civilised. It was not much more expensive than the Spanish Steps, which by the way refused to refund for the 2nd night that we cancelled. Before coming to Rome, we stayed at the Lungarno Suite in Florence and the Danielli in Venice both of which were good in different ways - and I thought a little sweet boutique hotel in Rome would be good but it turned out to be a nightmare. I wanted to make it special for my parents for their anniversary- but this hotel really ruined it for us that night.

Reviews.Title: “Be wary Can be Very nice or Very unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: worldllc
Reviews.Content: We booked through a travel who lack advising some key details. Last time booking throuh him! Some words of wisdom and experience as I was traveling with Native Italian family members who gave me even another perspective. 1) Only taxi's are allowed in this part of the city if you have a private car or rental find another hotel in another area of the city no parking or access here. 2) staff (bell, maid, waitress very nice) the reservation area is a mess. THE KEY TO STAYING AT THIS HOTEL if your going to, IS TO STAY IN THE HOTEL BUILDING NOT THE "INN" OR "RESIDENCE" BUILDING. There are really 2 buildings detached and the rooms are very different in each building. I stayed 2 nights, one in the Inn horrible and moved to the hotel building nice. It changed my rating from POOR to GOOD. 3) Since you are at the foot of the Spanish steps it continued to be noisey through the night with party goers. Although the second night in the hotel suite was great and the help staff was great I would not stay at this hotel again. There are so many other nice hotels (Hotel Barocco or Hotel Benini) in the city center. Nick, NJ, USA

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: smith01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend with my boyfriend back in February. I have been to Italy many times and stayed in a wide variety of accommodation. Our experience at this hotel was excellent. The accommodation itself was of a high standard, the breakfast was good and the staff were great. As this is a small hotel - the staff were really attentive and we felt very welcome. I would highly recommend this hotel to couples looking for a small friendly hotel in a fantastic location in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: NYCandbeyond
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Inn for four nights in early June. We booked a great rate on the slh.com website. I highly recommend joining the SLH Club (free membership) because we received a room upgrade and several complimentary bottles of wine, fruit and Bulgari perfume during our stay. The entire hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating - from check in to check out. They made dinner reservations for us, provided maps and really went out of their way to make our stay in Rome perfect. You can't beat the location just a half block from the Spanish Steps down Via Condotti (amazing shopping)! There are countless restaurants within a few blocks. Our room had a lovely little terrace and several large windows. Our room faced the courtyard so it was very quiet. Breakfast is served on the top floor both inside and out in the beautiful rooftop garden. Breakfast consisted of juices, cereals, toast, eggs, pastries, fruit, meats and cheeses. In the afternoon there is a generous complimentary snack buffet consisting of everything from antipasti to cake to mini sandwiches. Each evening we would take the bottle of wine that the hotel had delivered to our room and brought it to the rooftop and enjoyed it with a few appetizers before dinner. Our room was a very nice large superior room with big windows that we opened a lot and a marble bathroom with shower and tub. Housekeeping came twice a day. There is a small elevator in the hotel but the stairs are very manageable. I highly recommend a drink not only in the hotel's rooftop garden but also walking up the Steps to the Hotel Eden and enjoying a cocktail at their rooftop bar - Bar La Terrazza. Stunning views of the sun setting over Rome! The drinks are pricey but well worth it! In summary, this is a fantastic deal in Rome when you add up all the little extras the hotel provides and the wonderful service! I am very picky when it comes to hotel rooms and I always do a great deal of research before traveling and I couldn't have been more pleased!

Reviews.Title: “amazing location”
Reviews.Author: shelgreb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our vacation in Italy. We adored this hotel. Not inexpensive but for the price you must request a room facing the street. Do not take one of the interior rooms they are very confining and claustraphobic. Great great locaion at base of the Spanish Steps. A very safe area and it is convenient to walk almost anywhere in Rome. Our room faced directly across Bvlgari and was directly aboe Cafe Greco. Great pastries and espresso. Nice high end shops close to all good shopping in Rome. Prada, Gucci, Dior, Miu Miu steps away. Rooftop patio is nice for a drink. Pass on the lemoncillo not our thing at all. Breakfast was okay better than most hotels. Afternoon snacks offered betetr on some days than others. Executive room was quite large and had walk in closet and jacuzzi tub. Nice bath amenities. High ceilings and large balcony style window. A gift waiting in the room every afternoon. Champagne, red wine, bottle of Bvlgari perfume. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect fit”
Reviews.Author: rugburnz
Reviews.Content: Really loved this hotel. It worked perfect for us. Right in the heart of the action on Via Condotti and 50 yards from the Spanish Steps. The rooms were gorgous, the service great. Excellent breakfast buffet. Would recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice - Great Location, but be warned.”
Reviews.Author: EW1966
Reviews.Content: In short - my advice is to make sure you get a copy of their cancellations policy when you book. We were forced to cancel due to the death of my Mother and in fact cancelled within 24 hours of making the reservation. The hotel applied a charge of £1066. We disputed it through Amex having been ignored by the hotel despite 3 telephone calls and numerous emails. The person to whom we were directed dint even work in that hotel and they refused to acknowledge us. Amex upheld our complaint. 3 months later, the hotel re-applied the charge and then claimed that the email I sent them had the wrong email address on it. This was odd - how would they know unless they received it? Likewise, it was the same address from which the notification of charges was sent! I have visited the Hotel to personally request a copy of their cancellation policy - they couldn't find one. The Hotel is in a fab location, though a little noisy. It looked lovely - but it is very expensive for what it is. Try the hotel d inghilterra. It is only down the road and, whilst small, oozes charm and character. Nice staff too. Oh, and their very own cancellation policy.....

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZurichSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a weekend at the Inn at Spanish Steps for his 40th birthday. I have never felt so cheated in all my travels....and I have travelled extensively. The rooms were dirty and very crummy (wallpaper peeling off, mold in the bathrooms etc), the service was rude and the price outrageous (for what one is getting in return....!). The only attribute that this hotel has its location - next to the Spanish Steps and adjacent shopping districts. I am a frequent guest of relais et chateaux, leading hotels of the world etc. and I have never had an experience like this. I regret my stay at the Inn at Spanish Steps (so much so, that I wanted to let it be known on tripadvisor so that others can be aware!!)

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Annex”
Reviews.Author: LF1
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night at The Inn at The Spanish Steps and were disappointed to have been booked in the Annex. Not once in the entire booking process did the hotel elude to the fact that they have 4 classic rooms that are NOT located in the main hotel. They are not even located next door, but 2-3 blocks away in a condo building. This definitely took away from the experience that they sell you on -- the rooftop terrace and parquet floors in every room. Not the experience we had and just for that I would not stay there again. They could have a least discounted the room, which they did not.

Reviews.Title: “Position, position, position ... plus style and service!”
Reviews.Author: TurfTycoon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights at the Inn and it was a memorable and enjoyable experience. The low-key entrance next to Prada was our "secret" escape route from the maddening crowds and it was always a pleasure to make it back to the hotel. In contrast to a number of the reviews on this site we had a great time at the Inn and received outstanding, friendly and professional service from Francesca and the rest of the team. Our room (315) was bigger than expected and while it had a few problems / quirks they did not detract from the stay in any significant way. We did not have a view (unless you wanted to open up the curtains and windows and look at the backside of adjoining buildings and their plumbing / air-conditioning) but if you stay at this hotel you should not be thinking about a view - when you understand where it (the hotel) is located and the claustrophobic nature of the average Roman street you will understand. Besides, the lack of natural light seemed to help us sleep really well. The room seemed to fall away from the bed slightly (it is in a 200 year old building ...) and while the bed was firm and comfortable and the decor stylish and luxurious there were a few problems with the period(?) furniture. The wardrobe was really struggling with the uneven floor and one door was very difficult to close and the whole thing seemed like it might fall on you but rather than get annoyed we just laughed at it (we called it "character"). There was no drawer space save for the two tiny bedside units. The bathroom was quite large with a good bath and shower and a nice size basin. Italian's seem to like bidet's but we didn't use it. The room was thoroughly serviced every day and they even changed the bed sheets daily. Breakfast is included in the rate and it was easily the best small hotel spread we've seen. The roof top terrace is a lovely relaxing way to start the day with table service for your tea or coffee (I recommend the "american" filtered coffee with hot frothed milk). The roof-top also doubles as a bar and sitting room (there is a comfortable inside section as well). They serve a reasonable amount of complimentary canapes every evening but the drinks seem a little over-priced (but subsequent bar / restaurant visits tempered that view). We were so tired one night we even ate upstairs from the limited room service menu which included a very nice lasagne. The hotel is exactly where you expect it to be - right at The Spanish Steps (which are perpetually crowded with tourists and hawkers) - we were speechless when our limo pushed it's way through the crowds past the Steps and into via dei Condotti. Get up early and you will have the steps (and the nearby Trevi Fountain) to yourselves. At 7am the average tourist is still in bed (or not so centrally located to start with) and even at 8:45am it was quiet. The Spagna metro station is right behind the Steps (good Gelato in the alley) and only a 1 euro ticket to Termini (main / central station) or even the Colosseum. There are buses that run down the Corso (down the other end of Via Condotti) - taxis can be hard to find (especially in a taxi strike like we encountered!!). There are many restaurants, bistros and bars nearby but the quality is variable - the one restaurant recommendation we solicited from hotel staff was ok but elsewhere it was very hit and miss. Same goes for coffee and gelato - look for establishments run by Italians and patronised by Italians as there are some rubbishy tourist traps. The shopping on Via dei Condotti is reserved for those who have money to burn - the Inn is next door to Prada, opposite Bulgari and there are all the other labels you could never afford as well. The good news is that there are more down to earth shops close at hand - head down to the Corso. But overall my wife found the shopping a bit disappointing and the quality and styles very hit and miss (much like the food). Overall we found the Inn to be reasonable valuable for money, the room was comfortable, the service absolutely first-class and the location very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “first visit to rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the beginning of a trip I have dreamed of many years, and the Inn at the Spanish Steps was the perfect choice for that beginning! We were greeted at the airport and transported into the city by two most kind and helpful gentlemen. Our room was quite lovely, roomy, and the bathroom a lovely space, women appreciate that. The staff was so well informed, sent us to marvelous restaurants, found an excellent personal guide for us, and in general helped us in every way they possibly could. My welcome to Italy, Rome, the Inn was as perfect as it could have been. I cannot wait to return to Italy, I absolutely love the country, the people, the generosity of spirit, and I will stay at the Inn at Spanish steps again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: thepickytravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 5 nights and had a lovely time. We booked an executive room, (don't have 405/407 as the walls are paper thin) and it was warm and soundproofed from street noise. The 'balcony' is really just a ledge, so don't expect to sip coffee on it! I would go for a deluxe facing onto Via Condotti if we go again. Breakfast was very nice, plenty of choice & rooftop lovely sun trap with fab views over the city. Staff friendly and helpful. Be warned that the Spanish Steps are currently undergoing an Italian (ie. slow) makeover, so there's not much to see as there are hoardings etc. However, you can't knock the location & you're right above Prada and all the best shops in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Inn at the Spanish Steps is the hotel where we stayed during our Roman holiday, my family and I would like to reccomend it because our stay there was fantastic, my husband and I as well as the kids enjoyed it very much, the shopping on Via dei Condotti is great with all the brand name stores right next to the hotel, being a family of four with two small children we where able to have connecting double rooms so we could keep a close eye on them, the best part was the afternoon snack buffet at the roof garden lounge which the kids assaulted daily, the breakfast was great also. what a wonderful trip at least once in a lifetime must be experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed, overpriced, and stinky”
Reviews.Author: LGMG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in January at the tail end of my honeymoon. I had really been looking forward to the Inn, based on the reviews I had read on Trip Advisor and my husband and I had decided to go for it, even though it was a bit pricey. On the plus side, the location is phenomenal with a fun atmosphere, surrounded by the ultra chic boutiques and Porsches cruising by. On the downside, I was a bit disappointed since we did not get any honeymoon upgrade like they advertise on their website--I know its based on availability but the place seemed empty but they claimed not to have any free rooms. So we were shown to what had to be the smallest room in the hotel, right next to the stairwell with a view of the backside of the elevator shaft and their air conditioning system. The really terrible thing was that the room had the distinct odor of raw sewage. I am from New Orleans originally and I know that smell, the aroma of the French Quarter, and it was definitely coming from somewhere in that room. I am not naturally a complainer and so didn't say anything because I thought maybe it was just me, but after leaving for the afternoon and returning--it really did reek. At that point though we had unpacked and it seemed like too much hassle to ask to move. To be fair, it was elegantly appointed with a fresco on the ceiling and a tiny but luxurious bathroom. Not a fan of jewelry catalogs on the bedside table-seems cheesy. The bed was rock-hard with scratchy sheets and a thin comforter that looked a little soiled. The breakfast room on the top floor is relaxing with a nice selection of goodies to choose from. It was winter so a little too chilly for the terrace, but it looked lovely. Their "Evening Buffet" is a racket designed I think to get rid of some of the food from breakfast and charge you close to 10 bucks fro a cappucino--not impressed by that at all. The waiter left the door to their kitchenette open the whole time we were snacking so I had the pleasure of watching the mini pizzas go into the microwave--kind of spoiled the atmosphere. All in all, I guess maybe we made the mistake of trying to go budget thinking that the cheapest room at the Inn would still be a luxury experience, but we were wrong. I'm sure if you have the really big bucks to shell out for one of the nicer rooms, your experience would probably be much different than ours. I wish we had saved our money and stayed somewhere less pretentious and less odiferous.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We expect a lot from this hotel, because of the great review, the price and their association with Small luxury hotels. They really met our expectation: the location is perfect, the service was wonderful, the roof-top terrace lovely, the breakfast very good and the room was confortable. We just dream to return :-)

Reviews.Title: “great location, thats it im afraid”
Reviews.Author: PatsiStone
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day break in Rome to celebrate my partners's 40th birthday. I did alot of research on hotels, preferring to choose a small boutique hotel rather than a huge faceless one...The Inn at the Spanish Steps is in the most perfect location. However, we are both well travelled and I am afraid that simply because we like a bargain ( I got a deal somewhere on the internet for our room) does not mean that we will settle for second rate. The room we got given has already been described by someone else on these reviews and was a tiny, dark hovel with a window looking out to the sewerage pipe. There indeed was no number on the door and on 3 separate occasions our key cards stopped working - a minor hassle really. The staff upstairs on the roof terrace were lovely - friendly and helpful but the staff downstairs were a bit surly. They did not accept Maestro cards, something which I find incredibly hard to believe in this day and age....our bar bill was the final insult as we departed - 70 euros for 2 drinks each from the mini bar and 3 drinks each on the roof terrace. As I say, location perfect, but give me Le Petit Hotel where we stayed in 2003 anyday over The Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 3 days in March. Arrived late at night and the Night Manager was a little abrupt. Junior staff were more friendly. The location was great and all major sights were walkable. Roof terrace was lovely for breakfast. We were pleased with our room which was ornate and very clean. The lobby, stairs and lift are cramped but it is a historic building and something has got to give! We would certainly go back. One note of caution, taxi transfers to the airport arranged by the hotel (maybe all hotels in Rome) are double what you can get on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited rome with my boy friend and spent a fabulous week end at the Inn at the Spanish Steps with very helpful staff in a room spacious and very nicely furnished: N°409. The hotel is situated on the most famous street in Rome Via Condotti with all fashion shops like Gucci, Prada, Bulgari, etc.. near the famous Spanish Steps Place. The breakfast on the roof garden is delicious and served by very efficient staff. I enjoyed my stay at The Inn at the Spanish Steps and will return for sure!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Location.. For a Closet!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Inn itself is perfectly situated, intimate, and charming. But we arrived at the end of a wonderful, month-long stay in Italy to find ourselves in romm 301 which we could barely fit our luggage and ourselves into! (Should have known something was amiss when there was no number on the door!). Furnishings were quaint but the room overlooked the elevator shaft and the sewage pipe ran up the outside of our window! We complained and were told no other rooms were available. The terrace is lovely...Thank goodness we did not start our Italian holiday with accomodations like these! (We were in Italy, primarily Tuscany, from mid-September till mid-October 2004). The staff (except for the waiters/ waitresses on the terrace) were haughty and cool. Would NOT go back.

Reviews.Title: “Magnific Vue from the roof garden”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent the romantic week-end of St Valentine with my husband at The Inn at the Spanish Steps. It was magnific in a spacious room with original antique furniture, a bathroom with a jacuzzi, the personnel helpful and very efficient. The best thing was the buffet breakfast served on the roof garden with an unforgottable view on the Spanish Steps, the Via Condotti, the St Peter Basilic and the whole city-center. We were very satisfied of our stay and have recommed it to our friends, my sister, her husband and their 2 children will stay there for Easter. Don't hesitate to visit the place, you will be charmed!!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location !”
Reviews.Author: beenthereHampshireUK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at The Inn - it was to celebrate our 21st Wedding Anniversary. It is situated in the upper class shopping district and undoubtedly, the location is great. However, for SHL to call this a luxury hotel was an over statement to say the least. The room was average, some nice furniture was dotted around the hotel, room service took ages and the panini we received was not really that great - in fact, all food served by the hotel, was less than average, especially breakfast. The high spot is the roof terrace which you can sit at and enjoy the sunshine - or the torrential rain - whichever suits. We had a fabulous time in Rome but having travelled all over the world, my idea of a luxury hotel is not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Be Very Wary!!!”
Reviews.Author: CCKAUSTIN
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for this hotel while in Europe. We had spotty internet connection, and our reservation was duplicated. We cancelled the duplicate per phone and internet. Upon arrival, they agreed that our reservation had been cancelled and we would NOT be charged. The hotel lied, and charged us for the duplicate reservation. We are in a dispute with our credit card company, and now have our own attorney involved. Be very wary of this hotel!!!
